results.description:
Hi everyone!

Please be there 15 minutes earlier so you can get set up. Also, please bring a white t-shirt, a red t-shirt, lots of water and be ready to have fun!

We also created a map of the field location since it can be tricky to find: Field Location Map.


If this game is full click here for our calendar and see other game slots!


Thank you,

Paul

Details Below:

------------------------------------------------------

Game style and Rules:

HAVE FUN!!! It's SOCCER

We'll play (2) 30-minute games.

We will divide into teams based on everyone's experience and skills.

No ball hogging

The games are very laid back; rough play, tackles or sliding are not allowed and will not be tolerated.

If you arrive late to the game, you would have to wait until the game in progress is finished to join your team. Inserting people in the middle of the game disrupts the flow of the game, and it's not fair to players that arrived on time.

Field Location:Field F in Central Park  can be accessed from west 97th street or east 97th street on either side Central Park. We also created a map of the field location since it can be tricky to find: Field Location Map

Directions: By train: From the West side take the B or C to 96th street stop. From the east side take the 6 train to 96th street stop St.

Time: The game will start at the scheduled time. Please be there 15 minutes earlier so we can get set up.

Late arrivals: If you arrive late to the game, you would have to wait until the game in progress is finished to join your team. Inserting people in the middle of the game disrupts the flow of the game, and it's not fair to players that arrived on time.

Fee: Please pay the fee through paypal. Part of the proceeds go to NYC SOCCER KIDS (we already donated new soccer balls). It also goes to pay for the site admistration, meet-up fees, cones, soccer balls, and the new goals.

Please bring: A white t-shirt and a red t-shirt to differentiate players of each team. Please bring turf shoes, sneakers or all terrain shoes; cleats are not allowed!

Cancellations/Refunds: If you won't be able to make it to the game, please change your RSVP to "NO" 48 hours before kickoff time to receive a credit for a future game. This is done to give other members a chance to take your spot. Thank you!

Waiting List: If all the spots are taken, please get on the waiting list. If a spot opens up and you are on the waiting list, you will receive an automated e-mail letting you know that a spot has openned up:). Please RSVP as soon as you get that e-mail since everyone on the waiting list will get the same e-mail. The first person who RSVP's takes the spot! Also check our Calendar for other games

Weather Policy: Games will be cancelled if the weather conditions are severe such as snow, sleet or thunderstorms. If the game is cancelled I will send out an e-mail the morning of the game. Please check your e-mail. If you are unsure, or can't get to your e-mail, you can also text me or call me at[masked]-5725.

See you on the pitch!

Paul

results.description:
This is our first Conceptual Challenge Meetup! These are very similar to our  Lets Draw! meetups but the difference of this style of meetup is that it'll be alot more focused and immersive on a very specific theme we will work on together as a group.

In today's challenge we will each choose a symbol and territory from guilds set in a fantasy world. Once we have chosen our guild we will challenge ourselves to design and draw a character,monster, structure, or etc that would be found in this guild's territory. There will be 10 unique guilds to choose from each with a set of art and concept references to help you envision the environment,citizens, and aesthetics of each guild. The guilds and references used today will be from one of the most popular and well known card games Magic The Gathering!

The meetup will be split into three parts: First sketches and warm-up exercises, then an hour and a half  drawing your chosen idea and design, lastly we'll discuss each others drawings and ideas as a group.

So don't forget to bring your supplies and sketchbook as this meetup is going to be drawing focused! Also if you'd like to share any art or reference books with the group relating to the theme I urge you to bring them.

You can find me at the tables on the second floor of the Cranberry Cafe.

I hope to see you there and having fun participating in this new style of meetup and exercising or developing your drawing and conceptual skills with other imaginative artists throughout NYC.
results.name: Conceptual Challenge! Theme: Guilds Of A Fantasy World

results.description:
In COOTIES, a mysterious virus hits a small Illinois town affecting only the prepubescent population, transforming them into violent, feral little monsters. The virus centralizes in the town's elementary school, and quickly the infected students have the teaching staff under siege, acting out deadly revenge fantasies with an eerie sense of childlike glee. Finally, the teachers band together, led by a hapless substitute who grew up in the town, realizing they must do the unthinkable if they hope to survive.

In a post-apocalyptic future, THE KID, a young solitary scavenger obsessed with comic books must face his fears and become a reluctant hero when he meets a mysterious girl named APPLE. Despite their efforts to keep to themselves, ZEUS, the sadistic and self-proclaimed leader of the Wasteland, plagues THE KID and APPLE. Armed with little more than blind faith and an ancient turbocharged weapon, THE KID learns of justice and friendship and embarks on an incredible journey to rid the Wasteland of evil and save the girl of his dreams.


https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=G_he1HiLy0A

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=AFlZ6pVtnv0
results.name: DOUBLE FEATURE: Cooties + The Turbo Kid!

results.description:
Draw The Episode!

This meetup will be in conjunction with the Episode Screening, so lets take our favorite moments from the episode and bring them to life!

Each of the events are scheduled with community artists to demonstrate on the projector. If you are an artist interested in making a demonstration, contact me to reserve time on the projector.

Please note that we will have three separate sections devoted to people that generally want to practice on their art form. Main stage table for those doing the LiveDraw Presentations. Last section is posted for those how like to throw some conversations in the mix, yet to keep a distance for those who like to keep their concentration on their work.

We'll be bringing tools for everyone to use. these are the things we have:

• Two Laptops and a projector


• One digital drawing tablet ( Wacom Intuos Pro)

• Cintiq (Brought in by Geonine)

• The Phoenix Perch (recording device for traditional art)

• Pencils and a few sketchbooks


Please bring your own sketchbook, I don't have enough for everyone but I'm working on getting more for the group.

With these tools we are looking to cater to both the traditional and the digital artists in the best possible ways!

results.name: Live Draw #10: Draw The Episode!

results.description:
Join other single professionals for an early evening happy hour, topped off with about* 7-10 rounds of "mini-dates." You'll meet each member of the opposite sex for 5-7 minutes each (depending on the size of the event - EXPECT TO MEET 7 TO 12 MEMBERS OF THE OPPOSITE SEX*), turn in your dating card and then we'll send you the contact info of your mutual matches 48 hours later. On average, 80% of those who attend end up with at least one or two mutual matches.

Get the full details below.

* We run 3-5 Meetup Groups, plus maintain our own outside Dating Advice & Events Website. We advertise on Facebook, Twitter, Blogs, etc. Most registrations come through our outside events website, not Meetup. Therefore the number of RSVPs reflected here are NOT the total number of men or women registered.

~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~

PAYMENT POLICY:
$27- PAY IN ADVANCE ONLY - WE DO NOT ACCEPT PAYMENT AT DOOR

REGISTER AND PAY HERE: https://2015atwysspeeddatingnyc.eventbrite.com

(SEE MORE FAQ's BELOW)

ABSOLUTELY NO REFUNDS FOR LAST MINUTE/DAY OF CANCELLATIONS

~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~

FAST FACTS - PLEASE READ:

*We can not accept payment at the door for these events. All registrations must be done online via the Eventbrite link below before the event. No exceptions.

*RSVPing through meetup does not guarantee admission. You must pre-pay to secure your spot in the event.

*Business casual attire requested. No sneakers, t-shirts or active wear, no ripped jeans.

*We limit our events to 12 couples/24 people. (See reason below)

*You will have approximately 8-12 dates.*

*Matches are tabulated and emailed to attendees 48 hours after the event.

*Event lasts about 90 minutes give or take 10 minutes between check-in and all speeddating rounds. Speed rounds last 5 minutes each.

*You must register with a valid, correct email address.

*There are no refunds for cancellations, late arrivals or no-shows.

*You must arrive and check in within 20 minutes of the advertised start time.

OUR METHOD:

Online dating is great. But how many times have you chatted with someone just to have them fade or never make plans to meet? How many dates have you had that you thought went well and then ended up confused because you never heard from that person again?

The upside of online dating is that it provides us with so many options. The downside is that people start to believe that their options are endless, which leads them to move on quickly seeking that "perfect" match.

This is where speeddating comes in. To try and combat the "shopping cart" mentality of online dating, we limit the number of attendees to 10-12 per gender.  Fewer choices to distract us means that people are more likely to make a connection. Face to face conversations result in fewer flakes. That means fewer people get put on the back burner.


FAQ'S

The Organizer RSVPD with X amount of people. What does that mean?

That number represents the RSVPS (not registrations) that have come in through our other pages listed below. It is NOT the total number of people pre-paid. The typical number of people per event is 16-20.

What should I wear?

Business casual attire is perfect. No sneakers or athletic wear, please.

What if I want to give someone my contact info at the event?

Go for it! That's the whole point. Do whatever you are comfortable doing.

Can I see photos of other attendees?

Most people do not RSVP on meetup for privacy reasons. They only pre-pay and therefore do not share their photo.

Where are all the RSVPs?

About 50% of the registrations come through Eventbrite and our main events website. They are not Meetup members. Many people prefer not to post their Meetup profile or photo for privacy reasons. We often remove the event from the calendar once it has started so that people can't contact attendees without the attendee's expressed permission.

What's The Refund Policy?

Since we need to try and ensure a gender ratio as close to even as possible, our policy is that all registrations are final. We can not offer refunds or transfers to last minute cancellations. However, if you notify us at least 3 days in advance, we can give you a credit to another event.

Can I bring a friend for moral support?

You'd be surprised how many people arrive alone. We actually prefer that guests do not bring friends or "spectators." It makes the other attendees uncomfortable. Fun fact: The people who sign up and arrive alone tend to get more matches than those who attend with friends.

Will there be equal numbers of men or women?

That's the goal. We constantly monitor registrations and amp up promotion to try and ensure and equal gender ration. Sometimes there's 1 or 2 more men or women. Sometimes it's even numbers. This is heavily dependent on the age range and weather. We will NOT host an event if there isn't AT LEAST 7 of each gender registered, and we will NOT let there be an excessive (more than 3) amount of one gender versus the other.

*This is not a guaranteed number of dates.

See other RSVPS posted on our other groups. Please note that many people opt NOT to RSVP through Meetup for privacy reasons.
results.name: Speeddating Ages 35-48 - 1F/3M SPOTS LEFT

results.description:
Interested in speed dating on a Saturday Night? This event Saturday night is for men and women at M1-5 Bar & Lounge.

At present we need men (and only men) aged 32 to 44 although there's a little flexibility in the age range. Also don't worry if only a few people sign up on the Meetup as people will be attending from different sources.

Grab friends and come along to M1-5 to meet other energetic NYC singles, and pick out those you feel a connection with and would like to meet again. This promises to be a lot of fun, so you're highly encouraged to come down. To get your spot, you must:

(a) RSVP on the MeetUp site

(b) please also e-mail me directly at

<a>[masked]</a> to say you want to come and kindly give your age and first name.

results.description:
HETEP is an Egyptian word for being calm and content within the self.
Healing Touch Program gathers a community of people who want to communicate love, respect, and compassion through the language of healing touch. They care to keep improving their ‘touch intelligence’ so as to be aware of another’s needs and boundaries. 

A HETEP GATHERING starts with an invocation to the Elements and the various aspects of the Mother Goddess. The space created is sacred and safe for all of us to share our experiences - our thoughts and feelings, our presence, and the rhythms of our breathing as we participate in the expansion of our touch perception.

This event is expanding now to include everyone interested in evolving their 'touch intelligence'. It has been a monthly women's gathering and a wonderful opportunity to share and celebrate our intention, strength, and life experience!

You're invited to join this ongoing class at any time. It is 'by donation', because your healing presence is the most important material you can contribute! So please come and donate your body to the science of healing - we will return it renewed and energized. 

Every gathering starts with an introduction of ourselves in a circle. You will be introduced to this simple healing touch method. We will practice on each other on the floor lined with yoga mats and blankets. You may want to wear comfortable clothes and bring a yoga mat. This program is designed for every body shape and sensory ability - or sensitivity! 

HETEP facilitator, Karuna Ma has been introduced to healing touch very early in life. Since 1998, qualified as a Reiki Master Healer and Seichim Master Teacher. Seichim energy is sometimes called 'Egyptian Kundalini' as it is great at assisting a breakthrough experience for both physical and psychic well-being. Since her training in 2001, Karuna has been working as a massage therapist, energy and sound healer.
results.name: HETEP Healing Touch Program

results.description:
Teams are 7v7, 60min+ game. New turf at the majestic Grand St Field.


Arrive early and be ready to start on time. All players should bring a white and black t-shirt.

***********************************************************

Details:

1) Teams divide into equal ability - players are welcome to signup with friends.

2) No metal cleats. Turf shoes or molded cleats. Proper Soccer attire only.

3) Played in a fun and chill environment. Rough play, tackles, or sliding are not tolerated. Pass the ball have fun.

4) If no dedicated goalkeepers, players rotate in goal.


5) If you arrive late wait until a break in the game. Inserting players in the middle of the game disrupts the flow- it's not fair to those that arrive on time.

All players must RSVP, payment goes toward light rentals, field permits, equipment and fees.

CANCELLATIONS/REFUNDS:

You'll need to update your RSVP 24 hours before the match, to receive a credit for the next game. This is so other members have a chance to take your place.

See you at the pitch!

By joining this group and attending events you agree to the Waiver Of Liability.

results.description:
(***MEN AND WOMEN ARE WELCOME***) 

Take A Risk SEX is an experiential event where you take a risk to share and explore an aspect of your sexuality . 

When we experience ourselves as sexual beings, open to our full flow, pulsing with life energy through our body, we become more creative and feel more deeply connected to ourselves and to others. In this dynamic, interactive evening combining individual work with group process, you will learn techniques to liberate this energy and access more pleasure in your life. These techniques will be demonstrated through individual body readings with select participants who choose to take the risk of revealing a sexual issue and are willing to work through it in a supportive environment with expert guidance. 

Dr. Kincaid uses the teachings of Integral Evolutionary Tantra and the principles of Core Energetics to open up physical blocks and places where life energy doesn’t move. In Integral Evolutionary Tantric teachings and in Core Energetics -- a powerful body-based process -- sexual energy and life force energy are one and the same. Join us with body readings, deep truth, wild goodness, radical personal transformation and, if you dare, the evolution of your own personal enlightenment.

Led by Kristina Kincaid in conjunction with

The Institute of The Integral Evolutionary Tantra

Assisted by Tara Urszula Pietrzykowska and Cynthia Kagoshima

IET is a Division of The Center For Integral Wisdom


Saturday September 19th, 2015

7:00~9:00 PM

150 West 28th Street Ste 1104 New York, NY 10001

Admission: $20 

Tickets: https://www.eventbrite.com/e/take-a-risk-sex-with-kristina-kincaid-tickets-18459828845

Dr. Kristina Kincaid is the Director of The Institute of Integral Evolutionary Tantra, New York City. Kristina is on faculty at The Institute of Core Energetics and holds an M.A. in Energy Medicine and a Doctorate in Theology from Holos University. She is also a graduate of the Institute of Core Energetics and Barbara Brennan School of Healing. Her journey has taken her into deep explorations and healing around sexuality. She has a healing practice in NYC.
results.name: Take A Risk: SEX! with Dr. Kristina Kincaid

results.description:
Contra Dancing is Similar to Square Dancing but is so much more fun! The people are friendly! Let's join the public..

COST: $20.00 Cash, Possible Student Discount if you bring proof. Plus Receive Pass for FREE ENTRY at a future NYC Contra Dance. (For schedule go to www.CDNY.ORG)

7 PM: Arrive at Dance Location

7:30 PM: Beginner Contra Dance Lesson
8-11 PM: Contra Dancing for all to a Live Band!

_________________________________________________

RULES OF CONTRA DANCING:

* No Alcoholic Beverages --You may want to bring a water bottle with you.
* No Perfume or Scented Deodorant
* No High Heals, No Flip Flops
*Smoke Free Environment

*Wear clothing that is lightweight & comfortable

_________________________________________________

*No Prior Experience is needed

*Come alone or with a Friend

*Men can ask women to dance, & women can ask men.

*No Partner needed, people switch around the entire Nt.

*All Steps are taught by a 'caller,' like in Square Dancing

Contra Dancing is a cousin to Square Dancing but in my opinion is lots more fun! It consists of mainly walking steps and is easy to follow, with friendly people who will help you along! There will be Fantastic Sounding Live Music that you won't forget! It's Great Exercise, & you will have a Fun Time! Come join us! :-) **PLEASE BRING A SEPARATE PAIR OF SHOES WITH YOU TO DANCE IN or You may be asked to brush off the bottoms of your shoes if you wore them in (to avoid scratching the dance floor.)

*Please wear leather soles or soft-soled shoes that are comfortable and won't fall off your feet.

_________________________________________________

I'm definately looking forward to hearing & dancing to two different bands called 'Great Bear Trio' & 'Nor Easter!' If you have any questions about Contra Dancing, just ask!

This event happens annually, & is called 'ContraShock!' I am looking forward to it! It's soo much fun! :-)

Callers: Will Mentor and Bob Isaacs
LIVE MUSIC by GREAT BEAR TRIO and NOR'EASTER
results.name: SPECIAL EVENT**CONTRA DANCE IN NYC**LIVE MUSIC & BAND "CONTRASHOCK" Dance! FUN!

results.description:
Please join us at Neolyth for an evening of interfaith Kirtan. We'll be singing various chants from around the world and from different cultures. Come celebrate life and joy as we uplift the heart and spirit.

Kirtan simply refers to a singing gathering, but more so it indicates the gathering power of singing together songs of spiritual and devotional nature. The songs at the Neolyth Interfaith Kirtan are all chosen with that purpose in mind. The power of song is not just psychological though, though yes we can lift our mood with a song. We have the noble opportunity to contribute to the well-being of the world, to make a difference by raising the vibration for all humanity. Now there's a grand meaning to the sitting together, taking a deep breath and letting the sound come out - no matter how imperfectly! We can change the destiny of humanity, open the gateway for happiness and positive future for those we know and those to come after us! We are sounding instruments of fate for our own sake and those we love and care about. Bring your intentions, bring your courage, your voice, and by all means, bring your instruments too! Let's sing - kirtanam!
results.name: Interfaith Kirtan - Songs of Devotion

results.description:
White Lotus Tea Ceremony & the Angelic Realm- A Workshop for Healing & Rebirth

The White Lotus is a sacred flower from ancient Egypt used in many cultures for its medicinal and spiritual benefits. It is believed that drinking a tea of the flowers can bring about a state of euphoria and a deeper connection the angelic realm. The White Lotus is also used for purification and rebirthing. We will unlock the divinity within our hearts as we drink this holy tea and continue the journey connecting with the angels via shamanic drumming, Kundalini meditation, and tantalizing raw vegan chocolate treats.

All are welcome to join a delicious and enlightening workshop to nourish and liberate the mind, body, and soul. We will glorify the true magnificence of ourselves and cultivate a deeper unconditional love and acceptance for all.

Let us access the ANGELS, learn HEALING tools, and shine in the LIGHT.

We will:
• Expand our HEARTS like the lotus flower to the sun, connecting with our divine essence within.
• Receive visions via profound shamanic drum journeying accompanied by live guitar.
• Discover our own healing power with Kundalini meditation and mudras.
• Savor magical healthy raw vegan CHOCOLATE treats.*
• Embrace community and make new friends.

Where: The Three Jewels NYC
61 4th Ave 3rd Floor
NY, NY 10003

When: Saturday September 15

Time: 7-9:30 pm

Cost: $30 for one/ $55 for two people
***PLEASE WEAR all WHITE if you feel inspired to do so (or you are welcome to change once you arrive).

Please RSVP via paypal: https://www.paypal.com/cgi-bin/webscr?cmd=_s-xclick&hosted_button_id=H5Z3GRWWAQN72

Please RSVP via paypal for two: https://www.paypal.com/cgi-bin/webscr?cmd=_s-xclick&hosted_button_id=Y9XBFGNVLQE4C

All are welcome- no experience in meditation necessary. Everyone will enjoy a healing sensory experience.

* Raw chocolate=connection=love! Connection fuels our creativity and opens our hearts. In addition to promoting healthy mental and emotional states, raw cacao beans have enormously positive effects on the cardiovascular system in the body. Cacao contains polyphenols, the same beneficial antioxidants contained in red wine. It is entirely possible to enjoy the health benefits of drinking the recommended "daily glass of wine" by simply eating chocolate. Raw chocolate is divine.


Sarah Eve is a culinary shaman, making magic in the kitchen and healing from the heart. She is a certified Usui Reiki master and practicing shaman with a deep love of the healing arts. Sarah Eve began her shamanic studies with Izhak Beery and followed with the late Ipupiara, a Makunaiman of the Ure-e-wau-wau Amazonian tribe. She has completed workshops with Tom Cowan and the 13 Indigenous Grandmothers. The path of healing also led her to work closely with the Santo Daime community, John of God, and crystal energy work in Brazil. Other international trips including Mexico and Central America, Europe, Israel, and Southeast Asia, she encountered sacred spiritual practices and healers in which she is blessed to share and teach. She completed her 200 & 500 hour yoga training with Sri Dharma Mittra. Integrating her experience also as a vegan chef, she uses food as another medicinal tool in achieving whole body health. She assists in creating a safe space in which you can heal you. www.sarahevecardell.com

Amandev is a certified teacher of The Yoga of Awareness in New York City and abroad. results.description:
White Lotus Tea Ceremony & the Angelic Realm- A Workshop for Healing & Rebirth

The White Lotus is a sacred flower from ancient Egypt used in many cultures for its medicinal and spiritual benefits. It is believed that drinking a tea of the flowers can bring about a state of euphoria and a deeper connection the angelic realm. The White Lotus is also used for purification and rebirthing. We will unlock the divinity within our hearts as we drink this holy tea and continue the journey connecting with the angels via shamanic drumming, Kundalini meditation, and tantalizing raw vegan chocolate treats.

All are welcome to join a delicious and enlightening workshop to nourish and liberate the mind, body, and soul. We will glorify the true magnificence of ourselves and cultivate a deeper unconditional love and acceptance for all.

Let us access the ANGELS, learn HEALING tools, and shine in the LIGHT.

We will:
• Expand our HEARTS like the lotus flower to the sun, connecting with our divine essence within.
• Receive visions via profound shamanic drum journeying accompanied by live guitar.
• Discover our own healing power with Kundalini meditation and mudras.
• Savor magical healthy raw vegan CHOCOLATE treats.*
• Embrace community and make new friends.

61 4th Ave 3rd Floor
NY, NY 10003

When: Saturday September 15

Time: 7-9:30 pm

Cost: $30 for one/ $55 for two people

Please RSVP via paypal for two: https://www.paypal.com/cgi-bin/webscr?cmd=_s-xclick&hosted_button_id=Y9XBFGNVLQE4C

All are welcome- no experience in meditation necessary. Everyone will enjoy a healing sensory experience.

* Raw chocolate=connection=love! Connection fuels our creativity and opens our hearts. In addition to promoting healthy mental and emotional states, raw cacao beans have enormously positive effects on the cardiovascular system in the body. Cacao contains polyphenols, the same beneficial antioxidants contained in red wine. It is entirely possible to enjoy the health benefits of drinking the recommended "daily glass of wine" by simply eating chocolate. Raw chocolate is divine.


Sarah Eve is a culinary shaman, making magic in the kitchen and healing from the heart. She is a certified Usui Reiki master and practicing shaman with a deep love of the healing arts. She completed her 200 & 500 hour yoga training with Sri Dharma Mittra. Integrating her experience also as a vegan chef, she uses food as another medicinal tool in achieving whole body health. results.description:
Lauren, our fantastic and amazing member, is graciously opening up her home to a few members for a Wine and Cheese party she and her roommates are hosting! She's still not sure how many people will attend, so even through the RSVP list appears closed, still feel free to join the wait-list and Lauren will manual add people to the event.


Not only should you bring your fun self, but please bring something either homemade or store brought such as


• crackers

• fruit that goes well with cheese (e.g. grapes or figs)

• wine

• artisan vegan cheese, dips or spreads etc. (there are some delish vegan soft cheeses and spreads at whole foods )


• wine glass(es) if you have any to spare! Lauren and her roommate are planning on buying more, but depending on the size of the group, we may need extras. Unless you want to drink out of Lauren's tea mugs! ;)


I'm not sure yet, but I think I'll bring a bread platter with infused olive oil or perhaps treeline cheese.


Lauren's roommate will also be attending. She's not vegan, but she loves trying vegan food! 


Don't forget to leave your number. Thanks!

results.description:
Join us for Northern New Jersey's September Lock and Key Singles Party! A great non-intimidating way to meet singles in the Northern New Jersey area!

Lock and Key Events are the new, interactive and FUN way to network, meet your match, make new friends....or just to have a great time!

Details of our next Meet-up:

September 19th, 2015

10th Street Live
104 N. 10th Street
Kenilworth, NJ 07083

Suggested Age range: 24-49 ( if you are a little younger or older...no biggie!!)

Check-in : 7:00-7:30pm
Mix and Mingle : 7:30-9:30pm
Prize drawing at 9:30pm
Done at 9:30pm and then stay & party until closing with no cover!!

INCLUDES:
- DRINK SPECIALS during the event *, AND FREE APPETIZERS (until 8:30 PM),
- Free admission into 10th Street Live (no additional cover if you stay afterwards)
- Great prizes, and the opportunity to massively mix, mingle, make new friends, and who knows what else!


How It Works
Every woman gets a padlock. Every man gets a key. Your goal is to match the right key with the right padlock. Every time you unlock you get a ticket that enters you into the drawing to win great prizes from our party sponsors. Prizes such as cold hard cash, hotel stays, dinners, tickets to popular things to do and more. After every unlock you get another lock or key so you can get back into the fray and meet more people!

Register at www.lockandkeyevents.com/NNJ!! Use the code NNJMEETUP to attend for ONLY $21 - OUR MEET-UP MEMBERS PAY A MUCH LOWER PRICE TO ATTEND THESE SUPER FUN EVENTS THAN ANYONE ELSE. Or, you can pay $27 CASH at the door IF you put in an RSVP. Otherwise, it's $32 at the door!!

PRIZES!

Every time you unlock, you can win prizes such as:

One $50 CASH Prize! One - Pair of Tickets to see a Broadway Show <a>TBA</a> ($200 value/pair) One - Pair of Tickets to see an Off-Broadway Show <a>TBA</a> ($110 value/pair) One - Gift Certificate for 10th Street Live ($25 value) Complimentary Admission tickets to  Pre-Dating Speed Dating Events ($35 Value) Several Copies of the book "No More Dating Pigs - You Are What You Date" by Dating Author Norah Marler ($8.95 value each) Complimentary Admissions into future Lock And Key Events And more! Please email or call me with any questions!!

See you there~
Marcy
(908)[masked] or call[masked] (877-LNK-EVENT)
[masked]

results.description:
Join other single professionals for an early evening happy hour, topped off with about* 7-10 rounds of "mini-dates." You'll meet each member of the opposite sex for 5-7 minutes each (depending on the size of the event - EXPECT TO MEET 7 TO 12 MEMBERS OF THE OPPOSITE SEX*), turn in your dating card and then we'll send you the contact info of your mutual matches 48 hours later. On average, 80% of those who attend end up with at least one or two mutual matches.

Get the full details below.

* We run 3-5 Meetup Groups, plus maintain our own outside Dating Advice & Events Website. We advertise on Facebook, Twitter, Blogs, etc. Most registrations come through our outside events website, not Meetup. Therefore the number of RSVPs reflected here are NOT the total number of men or women registered.

~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~

PAYMENT POLICY:
$27 - PAY IN ADVANCE ONLY - WE DO NOT ACCEPT PAYMENT AT DOOR

REGISTER AND PAY HERE: https://2015atwysspeeddatingnyc.eventbrite.com

(SEE MORE FAQ's BELOW)

ABSOLUTELY NO REFUNDS FOR LAST MINUTE/DAY OF CANCELLATIONS

~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~

FAST FACTS - PLEASE READ:

*We can not accept payment at the door for these events. All registrations must be done online via the Eventbrite link below before the event. No exceptions.

*RSVPing through meetup does not guarantee admission. You must pre-pay to secure your spot in the event.

*Business casual attire requested. No sneakers, t-shirts or active wear, no ripped jeans.

*We limit our events to 12 couples/24 people. (See reason below)

*You will have approximately 8-12 dates.*

*Matches are tabulated and emailed to attendees 48 hours after the event.

*Event lasts about 90 minutes give or take 10 minutes between check-in and all speeddating rounds. Speed rounds last 5 minutes each.

*You must register with a valid, correct email address.

*There are no refunds for cancellations, late arrivals or no-shows.

*You must arrive and check in within 20 minutes of the advertised start time.

OUR METHOD:

Online dating is great. But how many times have you chatted with someone just to have them fade or never make plans to meet? How many dates have you had that you thought went well and then ended up confused because you never heard from that person again?

The upside of online dating is that it provides us with so many options. The downside is that people start to believe that their options are endless, which leads them to move on quickly seeking that "perfect" match.

This is where speeddating comes in. To try and combat the "shopping cart" mentality of online dating, we limit the number of attendees to 10-12 per gender.  Fewer choices to distract us means that people are more likely to make a connection. Face to face conversations result in fewer flakes. That means fewer people get put on the back burner.


FAQ'S

The Organizer RSVPD with X amount of people. What does that mean?

That number represents the RSVPS (not registrations) that have come in through our other pages listed below. It is NOT the total number of people pre-paid. The typical number of people per event is 16-20.

What should I wear?

Business casual attire is perfect. No sneakers or athletic wear, please.

What if I want to give someone my contact info at the event?

Go for it! That's the whole point. Do whatever you are comfortable doing.

Can I see photos of other attendees?

Most people do not RSVP on meetup for privacy reasons. They only pre-pay and therefore do not share their photo.

Where are all the RSVPs?

About 50% of the registrations come through Eventbrite and our main events website. They are not Meetup members. Many people prefer not to post their Meetup profile or photo for privacy reasons. We often remove the event from the calendar once it has started so that people can't contact attendees without the attendee's expressed permission.

What's The Refund Policy?

Since we need to try and ensure a gender ratio as close to even as possible, our policy is that all registrations are final. We can not offer refunds or transfers to last minute cancellations. However, if you notify us at least 3 days in advance, we can give you a credit to another event.

Can I bring a friend for moral support?

You'd be surprised how many people arrive alone. We actually prefer that guests do not bring friends or "spectators." It makes the other attendees uncomfortable. Fun fact: The people who sign up and arrive alone tend to get more matches than those who attend with friends.

Will there be equal numbers of men or women?

That's the goal. We constantly monitor registrations and amp up promotion to try and ensure and equal gender ration. Sometimes there's 1 or 2 more men or women. Sometimes it's even numbers. This is heavily dependent on the age range and weather. We will NOT host an event if there isn't AT LEAST 7 of each gender registered, and we will NOT let there be an excessive (more than 3) amount of one gender versus the other.

*This is not a guaranteed number of dates.

See other RSVPS posted on our other groups. Please note that many people opt NOT to RSVP through Meetup for privacy reasons.
results.name: Speeddating Ages 25-37- 3f/1m spots left

results.description:
SATURDAY SEPT 19, 2015


Gordon Webster & His Big Little Band

Opening our AUTUMN SEASON will be the incomparable Gordon Webster and his fabulous Big Little Band. Gordon Webster is one of the most sought after musicians in the world of Lindy Hop. His tremendous musicianship and passion, supported by his first-hand knowledge of social dancing, have inspired lindy hoppers at hundreds of dance events worldwide. see more about Gordon Webster

For tickets click here:

http://ebiz.jccmanhattan.org/PersonifyEBusiness/Default.aspx?TabID=416&pid=633143386

PRE-DANCE WORKSHOPS

6:30 Charleston & Variations | Specialty Dance Workshop


All Levels. Some experience recommended.


How to use the Charleston in your partner dancing. Learn Charleston patterns, variations and transitions great for enhancing your swing material.


Instructor: Gaby Cook

7:30 Dean & Jewel Style Lindy Hop | Specialty Dance Workshop


Intermediate/Advanced; 8ct swing-out assumed.


Learn the styling of the most renowned Hollywood Lindy Hop couple. Dean Collins & Jewel McGowen showcased some of the most dynamic & ground breaking techniques and were the inspiration for future generations of Lindy Hoppers. They can be seen in multiple films released during the 1940s and 1950s.


Instructor: Gaby Cook & Paolo

Intermediate/Advanced


DANCE TIMELINE


7:00 Community Vintage Market Opens for business


7:30 General Admission Doors Open


7:45 BEGINNER Dance Lesson (FREE with dance admission)


8:30 LIVE MUSIC & SOCIAL DANCING


10:45 Dance Performances, Announcements, Give Aways


11:00 LIVE MUSIC & SOCIAL DANCING


12:00AM Community Vintage Market Closes


1:00AM END


All Ages

Tickets: $16 early bird (before SEPT 16) / $20 Door


*specialty dance workshops extra

We advertise on Facebook, Twitter, Blogs, etc. Most registrations come through our outside events website, not Meetup. Therefore the number of RSVPs reflected here are NOT the total number of men or women registered.

PAYMENT POLICY:
$27 - PAY IN ADVANCE ONLY - WE DO NOT ACCEPT PAYMENT AT DOOR

REGISTER AND PAY HERE: https://2015atwysspeeddatingnyc.eventbrite.com

(SEE MORE FAQ's BELOW)

ABSOLUTELY NO REFUNDS FOR LAST MINUTE/DAY OF CANCELLATIONS

~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~

FAST FACTS - PLEASE READ:

*We can not accept payment at the door for these events. All registrations must be done online via the Eventbrite link below before the event. No exceptions.

*RSVPing through meetup does not guarantee admission. You must pre-pay to secure your spot in the event.

*Business casual attire requested. No sneakers, t-shirts or active wear, no ripped jeans.

*We limit our events to 12 couples/24 people. (See reason below)

*You will have approximately 8-12 dates.*

*Matches are tabulated and emailed to attendees 48 hours after the event.

*Event lasts about 90 minutes give or take 10 minutes between check-in and all speeddating rounds. Speed rounds last 5 minutes each.

*You must register with a valid, correct email address.

*There are no refunds for cancellations, late arrivals or no-shows.

*You must arrive and check in within 20 minutes of the advertised start time.

OUR METHOD:

Online dating is great. But how many times have you chatted with someone just to have them fade or never make plans to meet? How many dates have you had that you thought went well and then ended up confused because you never heard from that person again?

The upside of online dating is that it provides us with so many options. The downside is that people start to believe that their options are endless, which leads them to move on quickly seeking that "perfect" match.

This is where speeddating comes in. To try and combat the "shopping cart" mentality of online dating, we limit the number of attendees to 10-12 per gender.  Fewer choices to distract us means that people are more likely to make a connection. Face to face conversations result in fewer flakes. That means fewer people get put on the back burner.


FAQ'S

The Organizer RSVPD with X amount of people. What does that mean?

That number represents the RSVPS (not registrations) that have come in through our other pages listed below. It is NOT the total number of people pre-paid. The typical number of people per event is 16-20.

What should I wear?

Business casual attire is perfect. No sneakers or athletic wear, please.

What if I want to give someone my contact info at the event?

Go for it! That's the whole point. Do whatever you are comfortable doing.

Can I see photos of other attendees?

Most people do not RSVP on meetup for privacy reasons. They only pre-pay and therefore do not share their photo.

Where are all the RSVPs?

About 50% of the registrations come through Eventbrite and our main events website. They are not Meetup members. Many people prefer not to post their Meetup profile or photo for privacy reasons. We often remove the event from the calendar once it has started so that people can't contact attendees without the attendee's expressed permission.

What's The Refund Policy?

Since we need to try and ensure a gender ratio as close to even as possible, our policy is that all registrations are final. We can not offer refunds or transfers to last minute cancellations. However, if you notify us at least 3 days in advance, we can give you a credit to another event.

Can I bring a friend for moral support?

You'd be surprised how many people arrive alone. We actually prefer that guests do not bring friends or "spectators." It makes the other attendees uncomfortable. Fun fact: The people who sign up and arrive alone tend to get more matches than those who attend with friends.

Will there be equal numbers of men or women?

That's the goal. We constantly monitor registrations and amp up promotion to try and ensure and equal gender ration. Sometimes there's 1 or 2 more men or women. Sometimes it's even numbers. This is heavily dependent on the age range and weather. We will NOT host an event if there isn't AT LEAST 7 of each gender registered, and we will NOT let there be an excessive (more than 3) amount of one gender versus the other.

*This is not a guaranteed number of dates.

See other RSVPS posted on our other groups. Please note that many people opt NOT to RSVP through Meetup for privacy reasons.

group.name: Catholic Adults of Brooklyn Community (CAB CO) 40's, 50's +

results.description:
Join a bunch of singles from multiple meetup groups as we casually stroll along the entire length of the High Line while the sun sets. This is usually a VERY popular event. See the photos from one of last years' walks (Yes all of those people were with my group). 

What's the High Line you ask? The High Line is an elevated rail line transformed into a public park that spans 24 blocks on Manhattan’s West Side. 

Afterwards, if you are inclined, we'll have a few drinks and chit chat on the Frying Pan. The Frying Pan is a salvaged historic boat turned into a giant floating restaurant and bar. Cool right?!  

We'll meet at 7:30 PM on the corner of Ganesvoort and Washington streets under the start of the High Line and we'll get to know each other while we wait for everyone to arrive. 

The walk will start at EXACTLY 8 PM.  If you are late, you will miss us. Do not be late.

How will you find us? Look for the group of people standing under the start of the High Line and then look for the tallest guy there. That will be Beau, your Date Walk organizer. 

What to expect? Date Walks are very casual and easy-to-attend / non-awkward + the host, Beau is always there to make introductions. It’s really easy to meet people. 

Closest Subway: A, C, E and L 

Pace: The pace of this walk will be super casual.

Rain Date: If it rains this walk will be postponed to a future date.

When you come to the event pay $10 and I will provide you with a ticket that’s good for 30-days. Hold onto the ticket and come to any/all Date Walking events for 30 days. Just show your ticket and you're good to go. 

Why am I paying you a fee for a place I can go to for free? See the answer here. 

If you have any questions prior to or on the day of the event, please do not hesitate to give me a call.

Thank you, 
Beau, your Date Walking Organizer 

Call/Text:[masked] 
Email: [masked] 
Date Walking | Facebook­ | Twitter­

results.description:
hi Everyone, 

Summer is still hanging on just barely, but fall is upon us and time to get crackin' on checking out places to grub. First up is Al Di La, a cute Italian restaurant that is supposed to be one of the top places in Park Slope. I hope you can join me! I have a reserved a table for 6 at 7:45pm. 

Gigi
results.how_to_find_us: I will be at the front by the hostess.
results.name: Dinner at Al Di La in Park Slope

group.name: Brooklyn Foodies Restaurant Meetup for Women

results.description: Our highest level event, BB/A, two ladies on the court minimum. $100 at the door, championship bracket, prizes awarded... let's do this! Team ranking based on wins and score. Anyone can be a captain but bring the best you can!
results.name: GMAVC Tournament

results.description:
This event is being sponsored by Dave Cervini's New York Social Network at over 15 of their partner social and singles groups. The number of RSVP listed on this Meet Up reflect only a portion of those actually  attending.  If you have any questions, please contact the event organizer at [masked].

This event features the best elements of a Match Live Event, Speed Dating and an Ice Breaker Night.  Join over 150 fun and friendly singles for a casual and comfortable singles party that you won't want to miss. The World Bar has a cozy atmosphere that is casual, comfortable and relaxed so you can interact with others at the party without being distracted by the usual singles bar scene.  We will have games and activities designed for you to meet dozens of people there in a fun, friendly and flirty way.

Here is how it works..

-Upon arrive you will be given a name tag with your code name and a sheet to keep track of everyone you meet for matches.

-We will have several ice breaker games throughout the night where you will have a chance to meet others at the event and write down the code names and numbers of those you wish to make a connection with.

-At the end of the night hand in your sheet and we will send you the contact info for all the people who have a mutual match with you! You will be able to choose up to 10 people for potential matches.

The Night Will Feature:

-Drink specials till 9pm

-3 separate Ice Breaker games with prizes

-Complimentary Appetizers 8-9pm

-Music played at conversational levels.  Music is all in the background.  There will be no dancing (unless you want to!)

Can I come alone?Yes 98% of those attending will be coming on their own.  You may also bring a non single wing person who will be identified by pairs of wings.

What are the age ranges? This event will cater mostly to 20's-40's.

Dress code: No need for jackets or cocktail dresses but Keep it neat.

Admission: $15 in advance $20  at the door.
results.name: Singles Mix, Match & Mingle: NY"s Most Casual, Comfortable & Fun Single Party

results.description:
Join 100+ members for this unique singles party! It's a fun, new way to connect! This will be one of the friendliest and most social events you will experience! 

The atmosphere is casual and relaxed so you can interact with others at the party without being distracted by the usual singles bar scene. We'll have different games and activities designed for you to meet dozens of people there in a friendly & flirty way.  

PREPAY ONLY ($10, goes up to $15 as date gets closer) 

GET TICKETS HERE - https://dljparty.ticketleap.com/mixmatch/dates/Sep-19-2015_at_0800PM

Here is how it works:


• Upon arrival you'll receive a name tag with your code name and a sheet to keep track of everyone you meet for matches. 

• We'll have several ice breaker games during the night where you'll get to meet others and write down the code names & numbers of those you wish to make a connection with.

• At the end of the night hand in your sheet and we will send you the contact info for all the people who have a mutual match with you! You will be able to choose up to 10 people for potential matches.

The Night Will Feature:


• Drink specials

• Ice Breaker Games

• Prizes & Giveaways

• Food menu available

• Music played at conversational levels

PREPAY ONLY EVENT (No Tix Sold At Door).  Get tickets here - https://dljparty.ticketleap.com/mixmatch/dates/Sep-19-2015_at_0800PM

Can I come alone? Yes 90% of those attending will be coming solo. But you can also invite single friends to join you or bring a non-single wing person. Everyone must have a ticket to enter. 


Is this age/ethnic specific? This event will cater mostly to 20's-40's.  It is not meant to be ethnic specific or completely gender balanced. There will be age specific matching games but you will also have a chance to match outside of your age range.

Is there a dress code? No specific dress code. We just suggest "neat casual".

Why does your RSVP say +99? This is a multi-Meetup group event.  This page only shows a small portion of the actual attendees.  We will have 100+ members attending. PREPAY HERE - https://dljparty.ticketleap.com/mixmatch/dates/Sep-19-2015_at_0800PM

This event is a combination of a Match Live event and Speed Dating.  Join over 100 fun and friendly singles for a casual and comfortable singles party that you won't want to miss.

Here is how it works..

-Upon arrive you will be given a name tag with your code name and number..

-You will also be given a sheet where you can keep track of everyone you meet.

-We will have several ice breaker games throughout the night where you will have a chance to meet others at the event and write down the code names and numbers of those you wish to make a connection with.

-At the end of the night write down the names and the numbers of the people that you met and would like to see again.  You will then hand in your sheet and we will send you the contact info for all the people who have a mutual match with you! You will be able to choose up to 10 people for potential matches.

The Night Will Feature:

-Drink specials -Ice Breaker games with prizes -Full menu is available -Music played at conversational levels

Can I come alone? Yes 98% of those attending will be coming on their own.  You may also bring a non single wing person who will be identified by pairs of wings.

What are the age ranges? This event will cater mostly to 20's-40's.  There will be age specific matching games but you will also have a chance to match outside of your age range.

group.name: #1 NYC Singles Group - Meet, Mix, & Mingle

results.description:
This event is being sponsored by over a dozen different Singles groups.  The number of RSVP's listed on this Meet Up reflect only a portion of those actually attending. 

~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~

$15 prepay only

Pre-Pay here https://nysnmixmatch.eventbrite.com

~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~

This event is a combination of a Match Live event and Speed Dating.  Join over 100 fun and friendly singles for a casual and comfortable singles party that you won't want to miss.

Here is how it works..

-Upon arrive you will be given a name tag with your code name and number..

-You will also be given a sheet where you can keep track of everyone you meet.

-We will have several ice breaker games throughout the night where you will have a chance to meet others at the event and write down the code names and numbers of those you wish to make a connection with.

-At the end of the night write down the names and the numbers of the people that you met and would like to see again.  You will then hand in your sheet and we will send you the contact info for all the people who have a mutual match with you! You will be able to choose up to 10 people for potential matches.

The Night Will Feature:

-Drink specials -Ice Breaker games with prizes -Full menu is available -Music played at conversational levels

Can I come alone? Yes 98% of those attending will be coming on their own.  You may also bring a non single wing person who will be identified by pairs of wings.

What are the age ranges? This event will cater mostly to 20's-40's.  There will be age specific matching games but you will also have a chance to match outside of your age range.

results.description:
ALL AGES
$10 @ The Door = 4 hours of jamming & practice time! 

The Open Jams at Funkadelic Studios are great for musicians who are interested in networking with other like-minded artists, from beginners to professionals in all genres. Attending our open jams allows you to collaborate with musicians, and it's a great way to find potential band members, or to test out and get feedback on new songs that you’re working on!

Since first opening up in 1993, we have become a resource for artists of varying styles and personalities. The atmosphere at Funk, is influenced by our friendly staff and the cool vibe of our city.

Our Open Jams are held every Saturday and its only $10 to attend which gets you four hours of jamming and practice time! So come get something started, network, create and collaborate!
results.how_to_find_us: 5th Floor, on W40th between 7th & 8th ave.
results.name: Music Open Jam @ Funkadelic Studios

group.name: Open Jams NYC at Funkadelic Studios

results.description:
Please join us on Saturday, September 19th, 8pm for The FRIZZY DIZZY Comedy Show at The Room @ Dizzy's on 5th for the DOPEST night of comedy in Park Slope.

Why pay a steep cover charge + 2 drink minimum at a traditional comedy club when you can access the same quality entertainment right in the neighborhood for! The monthly stand-up show features some of New York's best up-and-coming comedians as well as seasoned pros. Dizzy's menu is new American comfort food. Tickets are $10.

September Lineup includes: Vince August, Neko White, Phoebe Robinson, Kali Ma, Jon Savoy, Monroe Martin and more... Hosted by Jennifer Salzman

results.description:
ALL HANDS ON DECK!

ALL SINGLES REPORT TO YOUR ROMANCE STATIONS ON THE DOUBLE AND TREAT YOURSELF AND FRIENDS TO AN EXCITING EVENING FILLED WITH COCKTAILS, CONVERSATIONS, DINING AND DANCING AT THE NORTH STREET TAVERN

MEET SINGLES FROM ALL OVER CT & NY IN A WARM, COMFORTABLE SETTING OVERLOOKING THE THE MAPLE MOOR GOLF COURSE.

 11 0THER SINGLE GROUPS WILL BE ON THE DECK!

 THE OUTSIDE DECK IS OPEN SO PREPARE FOR SOME FUN AND GOOD TIMES UNDER THE STARS

THIS IS A MULTI-MEETUP GROUP EVENT. OVER 100 SINGLES WILL BE ATTENDING. THE RSVP LIST ON THIS PAGE ONLY SHOWS THE ACTUAL ATTENDEES THAT  HAVE R.S.V.P.'d.

 IF YOU HAVEN'T R.S.V.P.'d YET, PLEASE DO SO NOW TO KEEP AN ACCURATE COUNT!

 BRING A FRIEND

Carpool if you can and bring someone you know, a friend, a neighbor, a fellow co-worker or grab an ex-relationship (one without a restraining order) and get down to one of the best Singles Mixer around!

 PLEASE DRESS TO IMPRESS OR CASUALLY NEAT!

 Just 35 min. from Brewster, 25 min. from Norwalk, 35 min. from Peekskill, and 40 min. form NYC.

 PARKING

We have all the convenient Parking you'll need right in front of the restaurant. After parking enter through the side door.

THE MUSIC

TWILIGHT ENTERTAINMENT will be playing all your favorite hits as they spin your music from the past to the present!
We'll have all your favorite dance tunes playing so there's something for everyone's musical taste!

COVER CHARGE

There will be a $5 cover at the door to enter regardless of whether you're dining or just at the bar.

venue.name: NORTH STREET TAVERN @ The Maple Moor Golf Club

results.description:
ALL HANDS ON DECK!

ALL SINGLES REPORT TO YOUR ROMANCE STATIONS ON THE DOUBLE AND TREAT YOURSELF AND FRIENDS TO AN EXCITING EVENING FILLED WITH COCKTAILS, CONVERSATIONS, DINING AND DANCING AT THE NORTH STREET TAVERN

MEET SINGLES FROM ALL OVER CT & NY IN A WARM, COMFORTABLE SETTING OVERLOOKING THE THE MAPLE MOOR GOLF COURSE.

11 0THER SINGLE GROUPS WILL BE ON THE DECK!

THE OUTSIDE DECK IS OPEN SO PREPARE FOR SOME FUN AND GOOD TIMES UNDER THE STARS

THIS IS A MULTI-MEETUP GROUP EVENT. OVER 100 SINGLES WILL BE ATTENDING. THE RSVP LIST ON THIS PAGE ONLY SHOWS THE ACTUAL ATTENDEES THAT  HAVE R.S.V.P.'d.

IF YOU HAVEN'T R.S.V.P.'d YET, PLEASE DO SO NOW TO KEEP AN ACCURATE COUNT!

BRING A FRIEND

Carpool if you can and bring someone you know, a friend, a neighbor, a fellow co-worker or grab an ex-relationship (one without a restraining order) and get down to one of the best Singles Mixer around!

PLEASE DRESS TO IMPRESS OR CASUALLY NEAT!

Just 35 min. from Brewster, 25 min. from Norwalk, 35 min. from Peekskill, and 40 min. form NYC.

PARKING

We have all the convenient Parking you'll need right in front of the restaurant. After parking enter through the side door.

THE MUSIC

TWILIGHT ENTERTAINMENT will be playing all your favorite hits as they spin your music from the past to the present!
We'll have all your favorite dance tunes playing so there's something for everyone's musical taste!

COVER CHARGE

There will be a $5 cover at the door to enter regardless of whether you're dining or just at the bar.

Please pay as you arrive and <a>exact change</a> will be appreciated. Thank You!

NORTH STREET TAVERN

Welcome to the newly renovated North Street Tavern, right off of exit 25 on the Hutchinson River Parkway.

The North Street Tavern situated on the Maple Moor Golf Course has great food, a large bar, a outdoor patio and dining room, all overlooking the golf course.

The North Street Tavern serves up Westchester Counties finest brick oven pizza and exciting dishes in a unique ambiance. The authentic <a>menu</a> and friendly atmosphere creates a truly enjoyable dining experience for all.

DIRECTIONS

~From CONNECTICUT~

Get on 95 S. to 287 W. (Exit 21) then take the Hutchinson River Parkway S. (Exit 9S), get off at Exit 25 and take a right at the bottom of the ramp, the Golf Course will be on your right.

You can also get on the Merit Parkway which turns into the Hutchinson River Pkwy. and get off exit 25.

From Danbury, take 684 S. to Hutchinson River Pkwy. and get off at Exit 25, at the end of the ramp take a right and the Golf Course will be on the right.

Just 30 min. from Norwalk, 40 min. Danbury, and 20 min. from Stamford.

~From NEW YORK~

From Points North, take 684 S. to Hutchinson River Pkwy. and get off at Exit 25, at the end of the ramp take a right and the Golf Course will be on the right.

From Tappan Zee & The Saw Mill Pkwy, take 287 E. then take the Hutchinson River Pkwy. S. (Exit 9S), get off at Exit 25 and take a right at the bottom of the ramp, the Golf Course will be on your right.

Just 35 min. from Brewster, 25 min. from Norwalk, 35 min. from Peekskill, and 40 min. form NYC.

PLEASE DON'T FORGET TO R.S.V.P. YES NOW, EVEN IF YOU'RE A MAYBE!

Thank You!

results.description:
Full-Field Soccer - 11 v 11 - Large Goals - Casual but grueling games. We are all here to have fun, which means no slide tackling :). Want to keep it as co-ed as possible. If you are completely new to soccer, come join, just let us know.

**** NEW RULE **** - Game Time Officially Starts at 8:15. If you are not on the field ready to play, or are literally changing to play, your spot MAY BE GIVEN AWAY to a member on the wait.list if they show up.

(1) we are keeping an 11 v 11 game, with 1 substitute per side. We will rotate new players in every 10 minutes.

(2) Please only RSVP if you will come. No shows ruin the game for everyone on the field, as well as those who would have come and played in your spot.

(3) Please arrive on time. All games begin promptly at 8:15pm. This should give any late comers 15 minutes to arrive in case you get stuck and time to warm up.

(4) Games will be 30-40 minute halves. We will switch sides at the break. 

5/11/15 - NEW RULES

• Attendance will now be taken by myself personally when handing out the bibs. If you are a NO SHOW, you will be removed from the group and banned permanently. 99% of you have smart phones and can cancel their RSVP within 2-3 hours giving anyone on the wait list the chance to come and play.

• If you are on the wait list and come to the field, and a no show occurs, by 8:15 you will be given their spot.

Fee is $3.00 for the night. Permit cost me $1200 for the season, I'm not out to make money.
results.name: Full-Field Soccer - Co-ed - 11 v 11 - Large Goals

The Royal Rumpus Room presents THE SHAKE DOWN: An Empire Themed Burlesque Show!

Join us on Saturday, September 19th, just before the highly-anticipated season premiere of Empire, for The Shake Down: An Empire Themed Burlesque Show at Smash Studios.

The Royal Rumpus Room family will bring the Empire dynasty to life one shake, shimmy, bump, and grind at a time. Featuring:
Essence Revealed
Chicava Honeychild
Genie Adagio
Diane Amore
and Vera Safire, our lovely kitten and go-go dancer!

Hosted by Tarik Daniels

Doors Open at 8:45PM

Show Starts at 9:00PM

Smash Studios - 307 West 36th Street 18th Floor, Showcase Studio I New York, NY (between 8th and 9th Avenue) Tickets are $25!

Get your tickets here: tinyurl.com/royalshakedown
*ADVANCE TICKET SALES ONLY* Tickets will not be sold at the door.

results.description:
Let's Get Dressed Up For A Night At Sugar Factory NYC!

Say hello to the Meatpacking District’s sweetest neighbor! Sugar Factory American Brasserie is a 3,000-square-foot palace of a sweets lover’s dream, offering both sweet and savory American culinary favorites. Sugar Factory serves breakfast, lunch, dinner, late-night dining and of course, endless decadent desserts... Oh, and the drinks are Legendary!


The dress code for this event is Classy/Sexy/Chic. Our reservation is for 9:00 PM, however, please arrive by 8:45 so they will seat us on time.

If the mood strikes us, perhaps we'll go dancing afterwards :)
results.name: Dinner/Drinks at Sugar Factory In The Meatpacking District

results.description:
Hello, and special thanks to all of you that came to the last LUNA party on August 8th.

With the event growing, things got too big and loud to continue hosting them in the private lounge that was our base. For future parties, the first being on Saturday, Sept. 19, we have found an awesome venue very nearby at Bushwick Public House. We will be co-hosting and rebranding in conjunction with Masht NYC, bringing their Heizen techno event to Bushwick.

We'll have two floors of fun now, with techno and tech-house downstairs and bass and ambient upstairs. Bigger sound, and party will go till 4am!

So far, Vermilion Bird, catnip, Oren C., and Fritz & Go from Masht NYC are confirmed to play, with special DJs in the works. I'll update info closer to the date.

Admission is FREE, and there will be drink specials all night at the bar. 21+.
More info at:
https://www.facebook.com/events/607391012697549/

We hope you'll join us for this party at our new home at BPH!
results.name: Heizen Resurrection - Techno in Bushwick - Saturday, Sept. 19

results.description:
This event is for anyone that loves playing Air Hockey! We will be holding a fun, double elimination tournament, which basically means that even if you lose the first game, you still can play your way back to the finals! 

Starts at 9, show up a little early to sign up and for tips and tricks from the event host! Entry will be $5, you're responsible for your own games ($1 each), so bring quarters and/or singles. Guaranteed at least $50 in winnings divided between the top 2-3 finishers!


Invite your friends, and let us know if you have any questions!

results.description:
Dear Friends, let's enjoy a "Hiking Nature Get-Away From The City". Get ready to take some really nice photos, an experienced Canon photographer will be available to take many photos for you upon request (a complimentary service).

Each person will pay $30 for gas, toll charges, and parking fee at the State Park. Each ticket includes round trip transportation by car for the entire day. 
A map and instructions will be emailed to each person, we will introduce you to everyone in the group before starting the drive to Long Island. 

Weather Forecast: It will be nice and clear at about 80 degree in Long Island: 
http://www.wunderground.com/cgi-bin/findweather/getForecast?query=Massapequa+Lake%2C+Massapequa%2C+NY&MR=1

After the trip, we will be driving back to Penn Station on 34 street and everyone may choose to go to the optional dinner in Korea-Town at around 8pm.

Please RSVP ONLY if you are 100% SURE that you will show up because seats are limited. 
NOTE: There is NO REFUND or exchange available for this event. 
Limited seats/tickets are paid online only and cannot be purchased in person at the event. NO CASH payments accepted. 

Tickets may be sold out before the event, therefore please try to get your tickets early while they are still available.

INSTRUCTIONS: 
STEP01: 
Please purchase your ticket on the following EventBrite.com web page: 
http://www.eventbrite.com/e/hiking-in-long-island-at-lake-massapequa-shopping-at-tanger-factoryoutletsmall-tickets-18589054362

Early Bird Ticket (No Refund):
$20.00
Regular Ticket Paid On Day Of Event (No Refund):
$40.00

STEP02: 
Come back to this meetup page and RSVP here too. 

Please be on time since traffic will start building up on the highways if we leave late. Everyone should arrive before 10am.  Pick up will be in front of the building (see address for this event).

Please RSVP now. Thank You. 
James & Marissa 
Event Host and Organizer 
Asian Business Network Corporation 
[masked] 
Here are some photos:

Join us for our Saturday Night Social Mixer@ Slate NYC. We always have a fun time at that venue.

The group will meet at the bottom section of the venue from 10:15pm. Please note that at some point of the night we will make our way upstairs.

You are always welcome to invite your family, friends classmates and colleagues.

Dress code is business casual.

We look forward in having a fun evening.

Contact us if you have further questions.

Cheers,

Rory

results.description:
I probably won't be able to make this as I will be coming back from a double feature at the Alamo Drafthouse in Yonkers.....but this is a free screening with the director, Ti West, present for Q&A.

Follow this link for more info and to RSVP free tickets.

http://svatheatre.com/events/the-house-of-the-devil-midnight-screening-and-qa/


https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=6SOur3WwZvM


A coed struggling to pay her rent ends up taking the wrong part-time job in writer-director Ti West's old-school 1980s-set horror flick, The House of the Devil. Samantha (Jocelin Donahue) is a sweet-natured and retiring young woman, unlike her rambunctious, loud, and self-assured best buddy, Megan (mumblecore stalwart Greta Gerwig). After moving into a new apartment, Samantha is desperate for a way to make a few more bucks. When Mr. Ulman (Tom Noonan) comes on campus looking for a babysitter, Samantha jumps at the opportunity. Once she convinces Megan to give her a ride to the creepy old Ulman house, Samantha learns that the job is not quite what was advertised. Ulman and his wife (Mary Woronov) don't even have a child. He tells Samantha that she just has to stay in the house with his elderly mother-in-law while he and the missus go out to celebrate the lunar eclipse. When she balks at the change of plans, he offers her more money. As the night goes on, it becomes clear that Samantha is a much bigger part of the Ulmans' plans for the evening than she would ever want to be. West established his genre credentials with low-budget cult favorites The Roost (which also starred Noonan) and Trigger Man. The House of the Devil also stars A.J. Bowenand Dee Wallace. The movie had its world premiere in the Midnight section of the 2009 Tribeca Film Festival.
results.name: “The House of The Devil” Midnight Screening and Q&A ---FREEEEEE!!!!

results.description:
Hey Everyone!


We're excited about organizing a Midnight Dance Cruise. This will be a Summer Edition of "Latin Dancing On The Water" that starts boarding @ Midnight. Then sails from 12:30am to 3am.

We Can Meet As Early As 11pm @ The Docks. It's Located Across From Houlihans Restaurant.

We Leave From Lincoln Harbor In Weehawkin NJ. NO TOLLS TO PAY & Free Parking Available Right On The Dock. :-)

We will be on a Gorgeous Party Boat On Spirit Cruise Line. We'll be doing sight seeing all around Manhattan's greatest attractions including the Statue Of Liberty! There is wonderful lighting all around and a very nice dance floor.

The DJ Will Be Mixing The Best Latin Hits Including Salsa, Bachata, Merengue, Top 40 & More!

Join Us For A Special Evening Of Dancing & Fun. Food & Drinks Will Be Available On The Boat For An Additional Expense.


Ticket Price: $35.95 Per Person Prepaid

Prepay Online With A Debit Or Credit Card:  https://www.paypal.com/cgi-bin/webscr?cmd=_s-xclick&hosted_button_id=ZXYKVRZZ5YNHN


Directions: http://files.meetup.com/7301052/NJDirections.pdf

It's the last exit on Route 3 In NJ before entering Lincoln Tunnel (Drive Slow). Please Arrive Early To Avoid Missing Boarding Time. Cruise Line Has Informed Me That All Sales Are Final.


Must Bring Official Photo ID To Board. No Exceptions. (Drivers License, Passport Etc.)


If Any One Is Interested In Carpooling With Other Members, Feel Free To Post A Comment. :-)

Looking forward to a great night!

You Can GPS Houlihans @ 1200 Harbor Blvd In Weehawken, NJ 07086 To Find The Docking Area Or Where The Boat Is At, Which Is Right Across The  Street @ 1400  Harbor Blvd.

results.description:
On Sunday, September 20th, we will be joining the Destination Backcountry Adventures team for a fabulous day out in Minnewaska State Park, about 90 minutes north of Manhattan. Pick up time is at 7am in Brooklyn and 7:30am in Manhattan. All transportation and a healthy lunch provided by the Destination Backcountry Adventures team.

To learn more and to register, please see: http://destinationbackcountryadventures.com/collections/holistic-adventures/products/shintaido

As a member of Shintaido NYC, you will receive a 35% VIP discount on this adventure from Destination Backcountry Adventures. Please call Dave DiCerbo at Destination Backcountry Adventures to register with your discount at[masked]-9878.

This is a fun day out and Sunday should be absolutely beautiful! 

Starting with a good stretch during Kenko Taiso before we head up the mountain, we'll then hike up to a clearing where we will enjoy a fun Shintaido workout or keiko on the mountain followed by lunch overlooking the beautiful vistas. After lunch, we'll hike down to an inspiring and breathtaking waterfall where we will conclude with a 10-point Shintaido meditation.
results.how_to_find_us: http://destinationbackcountryadventures.com/collections/holistic-adventures/products/shintaido
results.name: Shintaido NYC - Holistic Day Hike with Destination Backcountry Adventures
TCS New York City Marathon Tune-Up (18M)

results.description:
Hello F1 Fans,

Formula One returns to Asia for round 13 of the 2015 season, the Singapore Grand Prix. Since its inception in 2008, this night race has been run under the lights around the 5.065 km Marina Bay Street Circuit with its 23 corners, the most of any circuit this year. Three drivers (all world champions) have won this race: Lewis Hamilton twice (2009, 2014), Fernando Alonso twice (2008, 2010) and Sebastian Vettel thrice [masked]). 

STANDINGS - After a dominant win at Monza, Lewis Hamilton now leads by 53 points over teammate Nico Rosberg (DNF) in the Drivers' Championship. Hamilton has 252 points, Rosberg is second with 199 points and Sebastian Vettel is third with 178 points. In the Constructor's standings, Mercedes sits atop with 451 points, Ferrari sits in 2nd with 270 points and Williams claims 3rd with 188 points.

TYRE ALLOCATION - Pirelli will be bringing the two softest compounds, yellow (soft) and red (super soft) due to the low grip surface at night. 

DRS ZONES - There are two DRS zones: pit straight and between turns 5 and 7. 

So can Lewis Hamilton continue his dominance with his 8th win of the season? Or can Nico Rosberg redeem himself with a much needed win? Or can Sebastian Vettel make things interesting by taking his fourth Singapore victory? If you're in the New York City area and looking for some great racing action with other F1 fans, be sure to join us for the Singapore Grand Prix to see who will take the checkered flag. Race will start at 08:00AM EDT with the pre-race starting at 07:30AM EDT. It's going to be another fantastic race.

We hope to see you all!
results.name: 2015 Singapore Grand Prix

results.description:
A slower-moderately paced (2.0) mph hike. The Appalachian Trail at this location is a pleasure to hike on. Beginners, new hikers, old timers, anyone interested in a hike filled with magnificent scenery, uphill/downhill hiking, and accessible by public transportation, only 111 minutes from Grand Central via the Harlem Line MetroNorth train, come join us. Bring lunch, insect repellent, sun protection and comfortable footwear. Don't forget water, at least two quarts,

Public Transportation: Grand Central Station, leaving at 7:50 a.m. take the Harlem Line MetroNorth train to the Appalachian Trail stop. You may also pick up the train at other MetroNorth stations. Consult a train schedule. Arrive at the Appalachian Trail train stop at 9:49 a.m. Return time will be at 2:47 pm at the MetroNorth station on the AT. Arrive back at Grand Central at around 5 p.m. Those wishing to stay longer and hike more have the option of catching the 4:47 pm or 7:21 p.m. train back to NYC.

Driving Directions: Take I-684 from White Plains in Westchester, northbound until you reach the end, about 30 miles. Continue straight (north) on Route 22 north for another 15 miles to Pawling. Then continue on Route 22 north for another 3 miles until you see the Appalachian Trail sign and large parking areas on the left and right sides of the road. Arrive there at 9:30 a.m. The MetroNorth train station is nearby and hidden from the road. We'll walk there and greet the train.

Hike Leader: Steve Galla.  Text[masked]-2222. Inclement weather may change or postpone the hike. Stay in touch.

results.description:
THE GAME

Informal Meet Up. 8 vs 8. 2 subs per team. No Permit. Be warned - there may or may not be a permitted event at the location which could cancel our game.

Bring a white and black t-shirt, and good attitude.

This game is ideally for intermediate to advanced players, not for beginners.

RSVP GUIDELINES. IMPORTANT:

- If you RSVP and don't show, you'll be benched from this group for the next two weeks. - If you can't make it, Un RSVP, to give others a chance to play.

- If you didn't RSVP or are on the Waitlist, you're at the bottom of the line.

PLAY GUIDELINES

- No slide tackles.

- Respect your teammates and opponents.

- If you fight, you will be banned from the group, permanently.

- If you dribble more than you pass - you annoy everybody and will be banned from the group.

POSITIONS:

Being a pick up game, there are no permanent positions. If you've been playing forward for half the game and someone who's been playing the back line wants to play up front, give up your position and play some defense. When your team lose the ball, don't just stand and watch. Please support your teammates by get back on your side and play some defense.

Thanks.

**INJURIES & DISCLAIMER**:

Group Organizer(s) and Group Organization Assumes NO Risk Or individual Liability For Personal Injuries Incurred By Members/Players On The Field Or During Any Of Our Activities: Pick Up Games, Or Other Events. By Agreeing To Play, You Are In Receipt Of This Information, And Thereby Warrant That You Are In Good Health And Assume Personal Responsibility For ALL Physical And Accidental Risks Involved With Playing In Our Group, Including But Not Limited to Falls, Injuries, Contact With Other Players, and Field Conditions.
