results.description:
Multi-language picnic! PLEASE ARRIVE EARLY, READ all of description below so you're informed!  :)

We will meet BY THE BENCH at park entrance with FLAGS or a MEETUP SIGN from 3:50-4:10 PM. Please come early

"How to learn Languages" Workshop by Frankie! Begins at EXACTLY 4:30. 

Frankie will be going over tips and a few exercises to practice as a group.


We split into small groups by language. 10+ languages! beginners and native speakers welcome! Look for the sign of your language and join the group!

Language sections we have:
English - Spanish - French -Italian - Portuguese - Chinese - Japanese - Korean - Russian - German - Arabic - Hebrew 

If you would like to attend the event, you must bring either:


a) FOOD (would be great if relevant to your language but not necessary)!
b) DRINKS with plenty of disposable cups (2 large bottles at least)!
c) SUPPLIES, paper plates, napkins, forks (& knives, spoons) trash bags!

If you do not bring food you must contribute $5.


It is $1 to attend. This is a picnic! the idea is to share! Bring food, so you don't have to pay the $5!

You can either make or buy something but whatever you bring should be able to be shared with your language group. GUYS especially, you should spend at least $5 on something, it's totally not enough to just bring a bottle of water or a roll of napkins, (or 3 old bananas!), if you don't know what to bring follow the "abc" choice list above! Please be considerate to other members.

We will be mostly sitting on the grass. Bring a sheet to sit on & proper attire, forecast says 75! We will split off into small groups by language and spread out into conversational language practice groups of Spanish, English, French, Portuguese, Italian, Japanese, Korean, Chinese, Hebrew, German, Arabic & Russian.

You will have option to meet us at a specific corner between 3:50 and 4:10 (20 minutes). If you're not familiar with Central Park, please be on time, and meet us at corner, otherwise it will be difficult to find us! 

IMPORTANT RULES
1. Please CHECK-IN with us as soon as you get in for a name tag. 

2. We are asking all members to spend at least 1/4 of their time HELPING out in their native language! That way we all help each other, you meet people interested in your culture and you make more friends!

3. Please CLEAN UP after yourselves! (coffee cups, papers, etc) Members who don't will be removed from our group!

4. Fee will be charged $1 for the event

5. If you bring nothing you must pay $5 to attend.

6. If you can't come to the event please update your RSVP status before it closes, so other members have the opportunity to come.

Members that RSVP yes and don't show 3 times will be removed from the group

7. If you come to this event is because you agree to our rules above. We REMOVE members that break our rules, are rude, aggressive or socially inappropriate towards our members. 

*BRINGING KIDS: Due to some experiences and comments we had in previous events. We don't encourage anyone to bring kids to the picnic. You can bring them only if:

1. They are also learning a language.

2. You will have your attention on them 100% of the time. If you just sit in your language group and let them unattended you will be removed from the group.

results.description:
Let's meet up and explore untamed sounds, otherworldly scenes, and ever-so-slightly mischievous street art (no experience or skill required)!

In this creative support gathering for people living with mental health issues and extreme states, we'll be exploring the following game-activities:

1. NOISE JAM

What happens to music when the only rules are to listen, react, and explore? We will be using found objects, our own voices and bodies, a computer, a radio, a drum, and a single, two-stringed guitar to probe the infinite and often mind-altering depths of improvised experimental music/sound art!

2. PARK BENCH

Park Bench is the greatest acting improv game of all time. Basically, there are two seats representing a park bench. One individual sits in one seat, acting as their normal self. Another individual comes along, sits in the other seat and acts in such a way (awkward, creepy, strange...) that the first character decides to leave. The actor of the strange character then takes the other actor's seat and starts acting like their normal self, and the cycle repeats with a new actor. (Nobody will be forced to play if they don't want to but I do highly recommend it!)

3. NON-GRAFFITI STREET ART

We will be continuing our project of working on non-graffiti street decorations for the streets of New York City. I also thought if people wanted to we could experiment with collaborating on decorations more than we have on the past, meaning several or all people working on a single decoration at once.

As always, there will be plenty of time during and after the group to hang out and get to know one another!

Hope to see you there!

-Josh K.
results.name: NOISE JAM + "PARK BENCH" + NON-GRAFFITI STREET ART!

results.description:
Transliminality is a term popularized by Australian parapsychologist Michael Thalbourne which he defined as the ability for psychological material to cross the threshold of consciousness. Thalbourne has conducted much scientific research into the correlation between transliminality and many other personality traits. He found significant relationships with creative personality, paranormal belief, magical ideation, some types of mental illness, and fantasy proneness, among others. The alleged conclusion is that persons who score higher on measures of transliminality have a lower threshold such that material normally contained within the subconscious is able to pass more easily into the conscious mind thus resulting in a greater readiness to accept phenomena commonly believed to be paranormal.

Is it possible that transliminality also drives our desire to know cosmic consciousness? Already open to paranormal belief, people who are biologically predisposed to being more ‘transliminal’ seek out confirmation of their beliefs in the outside world. They delve into religions, occult sciences, magick, meditation, and anything else they can find to confirm a physiologically-based belief in the paranormal.

Check out some research and feel free to look over the scale to see how transliminal you might be!


Some resources:
http://onlinelibrary.wiley.com/doi/10.1002/j.2162-6057.2000.tb01211.x/abstract
http://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pubmed/11150227
One of the scales:
http://www.aiprinc.org/Thalbournes_Transliminality_Scale.pdf
Research article with data using the given scale:
http://www.academia.edu/2194141/The_Revised_Transliminality_Scale_Reliability_and_validity_data_from_a_Rasch_top-down_purification_procedure
results.name: Understanding how transliminality impacts your belief in greater consciousness

Please, arrive 10 minutes before the game so we can get the teams set up.

Game Format:

We'll play three simultaneous games of 8 on 8, with small goals. There will be 6 teams on the field and we will play THREE games, 30 minutes/game. Every 30 minutes we will have a short break and teams will switch to play against different team. Please check our meetup message board on Friday night or before 12.00 pm on Saturday to see what team you are on. This will save us a lot of time on the field.

RULES OF THE GAME:

First and most important rule of the game is to have fun and enjoy the time on the field! Rough play and offensive language will absolutely not be tolerated!!! In plain words, no slide tackling, no pushing and no telling off.

No power shots allowed. No power shots means; you can shoot the ball but not as hard as you can. This doesn't mean that you can not take the shot at all. Kicking the ball or taking the shot on the goal, is of course allowed.

***If you don't sign up for the game, do not show up.***

If you are late for the game, you must wait until the game in progress is over to join your team.

Those that don't comply with these rules, will kindly be asked to leave the field so others can enjoy the game and maybe a two game ban.

Any other questions regarding the rules of the game or anything else, should be directed to the organizer directly or to the assistant organizer/s!!!

Location:

CHELSEA PARK.

Between 27th and 28th street and 10th Avenue.

Take A, C or E to 23rd St and 8th Ave and walk to 10th Ave and 27th St or any subway line to 34th St and Penn Station and walk for about 8 minutes to 28th St and 10th Ave.

What to bring with you:

A pair of sneakers, indoor or turf shoes, shin guards (recommended) and lots of water. There is a water fountain next to the park if you need extra water.

Fee:

You will be asked to pay $9.25 when you RSVP. This $9.25 is used to pay for, facilities permits, meetup fees, Amazon fees, goals, cones, soccer balls etc.

Refunds & Weather Policy:

Refunds will be issued if the RSVP is changed by Wednesday before 12.00PM or if the game is cancelled. The game can be cancelled if the weather conditions are severe like heavy rain, snow or thunder.

After the game we'll go to Molly Wee for a pint or two:

                             Molly Wee Restaurant

                                       402 8th Ave, 

                                 New York, NY 10001

                            PLEASE CHECK THEIR MENU!

                                      themollywee.com

The Ceramics Studio offers some of the best facilities for pottery wheel and ceramics classes on the Upper West Side. As a part of the community center setting, we strive to offer an inviting work environment where ideas, creativity, and laughs are shared. results.description:
11th Annual FALL EQUINOX/ MABON SABBAT CELEBRATION

The September Equinox is always a beautiful, natural phenomenon worthy of our recognition and honor. On this particular holiday, we laugh and we cry.

Mabon puts us in touch with the transformational elements of life here on Earth. This is a bittersweet stop on the ever-turning Wheel of the Year.

The Autumn Equinox /Mabon ritual carries the wisdom of the ages and hopefully divine inspiration, which will give sacred life and meaning to the many challenges and changes we face, and to the light and shadows around us.

We, are the priestesses (all females) and priests (all males) paint little blue tears on our faces. Some of us literally cry, mourning the gradual disappearance of the Sun, but then we immediately rejoice and thank the Mother for giving birth to the Son, for holding him in Her womb, and for nurturing him.

By participating in rituals like Mabon, it helps to reconnect us with a heightened sense of spirituality. We become more fluent in communing with experiences that often defy understanding in the physical world. We learn to balance reality or our position in everyday society with Nature. We might discover the need for a change in our lives, or we might convey a passionate commitment to protect our environment. Becoming more insightful, empathetic, and enjoyable.

EVERYONE MUST BRING A DISH OF ANY KIND FOR US ALL TO PARTAKE IN THIS GIANT FEAST CELEBRAATING THE HARVEST. Dishes like potatoes, corn, breads, juices, wines, meats, vegetables etc. Let’s give thanks with a true buffet style Harvest Dinner.

Attire: Suggested colors are black – you can add colors of the Sun and Earth to it like orange, yellow, wine, russet, copper, gold bronze and brown (not required for attendance) .

IF ANYONE HAS HAND INSTRUMENTS PLEASE BRING AS MANY AS POSSIBLE, DRUMMING BRINGS GREAT ENERGIES TOGETHER, as we always create our own music.

A fee of $15.00 in person $16.00 via online payments is required. (Please bring receipt of online payment).

www.wftacademyofpaganstudies.org

www.wiccanfamilytemple.org

www.charmedbystarr.com.

THANK YOU, BLESSED BE.

results.description:
This is Sunday is Brooklyn's free Literary and Book festival which features a wide range of topics and presentations by authors in a variety of cool Brooklyn Heights and Downtown venues.  

The walking tour  begins at 6pm at the steps of Borough Hall and will cover the history, architecture and real estate of the neighborhood along with its rich literary tradition. (please only RSVP if you haven't been on a Brooklyn Heights tour).  We'll stop by the house where Truman Capote penned "breakfast of Tiffany's" and "In Cold Blood" and enjoy the views of NY Harbor and the skyline from the Promenade.  We'll head down to Brooklyn Bridge Park and Fulton Ferry for an optional dinner/and or drinks.

For those coming at 5pm we'll meet at the Main Stage outside at Columbus Park - 1 block from the tour  our meetup location, there will the following presentation about what's happening in Brooklyn today which should be worthwhile.

Brooklyn Places and Spaces presented by Explore Brooklyn. Brooklyn is the home of the Brooklyn Book Festival and so much more! The 4th largest "city" in America has its own new guide! Arabella Bowen,Fodor's Editor in Chief, will be on hand to introduce Fodor's Brooklyn, which features reviews by notable neighborhood residents and tips, maps and best bet recommendations! Paired with Oriana Leckert, author of the compendium of culture and subculture book, Brooklyn Spaces. The program offers the insider low-down about Brooklyn. Moderated by Carlo Scissura, CEO and President of the Brooklyn Chamber of Commerce.

Here's a link to the options for the rest of the day:  I may go to a few earlier events but will be working most of the afternoon.

http://www.brooklynbookfestival.org/2015/festival-events

results.description:
A reading of two one-act plays about NYC, written and directed by VSL's own Jack Feldstein!

THE VOICES OF JULIE LEVINE

When Julie Levine's father re-appears, he's obsessed with an insane plan concerning the Jews of New York. One that drives Julie crazy in every way.

THE CONFESSIONS OF PETER McDOWELL

In the cut-throat world of New York theater, middle-aged artistic director and playwright Peter McDowell must face his greatest challenge ever when 19 year old playwriting genius, Andrew Livingston enters the scene. And forces Peter McDowell to face his worst nemesis: himself.

Read by Mick Bleyer, Bob Manus, Susan Izatt, Lila Smith, Richard Kent Green and Ty Baumann; moderated by Mark Loewenstern.

Part of the Sundays@Six Series.

results.description:
Meet to see the Alfred Hitchcock classic film "Psycho". The film came out in 1960 and caused quite a stir, became highly popular and affected future film makers.

MEETING: Meet at 5:45PM by the ticket machines. At 6:00PM get seats. The classic movies get pretty crowded so let's get here a little earlier. After the movie meet in the lobby then walk over to a nearby restaurant.
Tickets: if you want to buy in advance get the 9/20 7:00PM showtime on www.amctheatres.com/movies/tcm-presents-psycho#[masked]


Synopsis:
A Phoenix secretary steals $40,000 from her employer's client, goes on the run and checks into a remote motel run by a young man under the domination of his mother.

Director: Alfred Hitchcock
Writers: Joseph Stefano (screenplay), Robert Bloch (novel)
Stars: Anthony Perkins, Janet Leigh, Vera Miles Part of article by Stephen Robb- see
http://news.bbc.co.uk/2/hi/uk_news/magazine/8593508.stm
Alfred Hitchcock had made his name as the "master of suspense" with brilliant, glossy thrillers like Rear Window and North by Northwest, but Psycho was altogether different - the like of which most cinema-goers had never seen.

With its shocking bursts of violence and provocative sexual explicitness, Psycho tested the strict censorship boundaries of the day as well as audiences' mettle - and it gave Hitchcock the biggest hit of his career.
results.name: Classic Movie Night- original "Psycho" (7:00PM Show)

***REGISTRATION closes 45 minutes prior to the webcast.***  Please make sure you sign-up on our website at least 45 mins prior to the webcast to receive your live log-in link via email.


(Technical Support: <a>[masked]</a>)


The Inner Engineering online program includes guided meditations, powerful breathing techniques, and deeply engaging discourses about the nature of the mind and practical wisdom to manage life’s situations.

Inner Engineering is a combination of methods derived from the ancient science of yoga that addresses every aspect of human well-being — from your body, mind and emotions to the fundamental of life energy within. 

This 1 hour introduction to Inner Engineering explains the fundamental approach of the program in a live setting that offers you the opportunity to ask a trained Isha teacher questions about the program and practices available.

“Inner Engineering is neither a religion, nor a philosophy or dogma; It is a technology for wellbeing. One does not have to believe or disbelieve, you just have to learn to use it. Technology will produce results irrespective of who you are.” – Sadhguru

Over 200 singles ages 20s, 30s, and early 40s will be in attendance, and DJ TRST will be spinnin' dance music of the past-present. We’ll have complimentary appetizers, fun ice breakers, prizes, and two levels & two cash bars. Love will be in the air and drinks will be flowing...

FAQs:

What's the dress code? There is no strict dress code, but please dress to make a good first impression. Gentlemen: No shorts.

At what time does the boat depart? The boat departs at 6pm sharp. We will begin boarding at 5:20pm.

Where does the boat sail? The boat sails around Manhattan for the duration of our event. You will see incredible views of the NYC skyline, status of liberty, and more.

What kind of food is served? We'll have complimentary light appetizers. Light appetizers does not mean dinner, please eat before you attend our event.

What's the ice breaker? To make it easy for singles to meet, we will have a game to help people break the ice with each other and talk. Each man and woman will get half a card, find the person of the opposite sex with the other half of the card and win a prize.

What are the prizes? We have off-Broadway tickets, comedy show tickets, tickets to future singles events and more!

• DJ

• Ice-Breakers

• Cash bar

• Prizes

*MUST PREPAY AT THIS LINK (No tix sold at door):  http://dljparty.ticketleap.com/finalcruise/

results.description:
Featuring flavors originating from the shores of Southern France to the North African coast and beyond, chef Daniel Boulud’s vibrant Mediterranean-inspired menu puts an emphasis on grilled fish and lamb and fresh vegetables galore. Interior design treats are also on offer: We’ll dine among artworks by Vik Muniz in a light-filled Mid-century Modern space decorated in pear wood paneling and tones of sunflower yellow and slate grey.


The event price of $93 includes three courses, coffee or tea, tax, tip, and service charge; it excludes alcoholic and other beverages. We will be seated at two tables of six or eight.
results.name: Dinner at Boulud Sud

results.description:
It's our ninth anniversary of the founding of the group!!  I couldn't find anything good with "nine" in the title so we'll have to settle for "Autumn" on the last day of Summer. ;p

"Shortlisted for the 1977 Booker Prize

This is the story of four people in late middle-age. Lovingly, poignantly, satirically and with much humour, Pym conducts us through their small lives and the facade they erect to defend themselves against the outside world. There is nevertheless an obstinate optimism in her characters, allowing them in their different ways to win through to a kind of hope. Barbara Pym's sensitive wit and artistry are at their most sparkling in "Quartet in Autumn"." - Amazon


Reviews:

"An exquisite, even magnificent work of art" - Observer

"'Barbara Pym has a sharp eye for the exact nuances of social behaviour" - The Times

"The wit and style of a twentieth century Jane Austen" - Harpers & Queen

"Barbara Pym's unpretentious, subtle, accomplished novels are for me the finest examples of high comedy to have appeared in England during the past 75 years ...spectacular" - Sunday Times

"Very funny and keenly observant of the ridiculous as well as the pathetic in humanity" - Financial Times


About the Author:

"Barbara Mary Crampton Pym (2 June 1913 – 11 January 1980) was an English novelist. In the 1950s she published a series of social comedies, of which the best known are Excellent Women (1952) and A Glass of Blessings (1958). In 1977 her career was revived when the biographer David Cecil and the poet Philip Larkin both nominated her as the most under-rated writer of the century. Her novel Quartet in Autumn (1977) was nominated for the Booker Prize that year, and she was elected as a Fellow of the Royal Society of Literature." - Wikipedia


____________________________ 

** NOTE : I WILL BE EMAILING MEMBERS ASKING YOU TO CONFIRM YOUR "YES" RSVP A FEW DAYS BEFORE THE MEETUP, WITH YOUR REPLY DUE NO LATER THAN APPROXIMATELY 24 HOURS BEFORE THE EVENT SO WE CAN GET A PRETTY ACCURATE HEADCOUNT. PLEASE REMEMBER TO CHANGE A "YES" RSVP TO A "NO" IF YOUR PLANS CHANGE, SO MEMBERS ON THE WAITING LIST HAVE A CHANCE TO READ THE BOOK. AND REMEMBER TO SEE THE "PAGES" LINK FOR THE NO-SHOW POLICY, IT'S STRICTLY ENFORCED. THANKS
results.name: September DINNER (Ninth Anniversary) - Quartet in Autumn (Barbara Pym)

results.description:
About-

A bi-monthly dinner party that combines elements of fun, health, friendship, and the joy of cooking. One of the biggest challenges for getting and staying healthy is finding support and motivation on the journey! This is a great place to meet other women with similar missions and find the support you've been dreaming of!

The Goal-

To provide you with fun, easy to implement tools to rock a healthy lifestyle as a busy New Yorker. 

Includes-

Movement to get your blood and energy flowing, a delicious dinner with complimentary "mocktails", a group discussion and meditation, support and motivation during and after the event. 

This Weeks Menu-

Pear, Watercress and Ginger Martini

Swiss Chard Veggie Wraps with Thai Peanut Sauce 

Cocoa and Maple Brownies

This Weeks Topic-

Honoring yourself- what it means and the best ways to do it!

What to bring-

Yourself (and friends!), a positive attitude, adventurous spirit, and appetite! 

Casual and comfortable attire is recommended

Price- $25


Address:

291 Broadway Room 806

New York, New York 10007
results.name: Ladies Plant Based Dinner Party

results.description:
Let's take our practice outside this Sunday in Fort Lee Historic Park!  Our lovely scenic lawn is waiting for us! Bring your mat or a beach towel and some water if the weather is hot.  I can bring some extra mats if you let me know in advance. Also, if you need a ride from Shala Zeni, message me or let me know in the comments and be at the Shala at 5:40pm please (if I don't hear specifically, I'll assume you are meeting us at the park). 


We'll meet at 6PM at the Fort Lee Historic Park parking lot and will walk from there to a hidden lawn at the Southern-most point of the park with scenic overlook of the GW bridge, Manhattan skyline & Edgewater marina.  

DIRECTIONS (by car, walking, bike or public transportation): CLICK HERE or see picture below.  Meeting point is at the top of the ramp inside the park (where the star is on the picture).  

Pricing: $10 per person.

• You must get your ticket in advance. RSVPing without pre-payment will not get you into the event. We're expecting a sell out. Tickets are only refundable if cruise is cancelled.

Ticket Price: $25 (Will be going up to $40 as event approaches)
Not Tickets Will Be Sold At Boat. You Must Pre-Pay Online At The Below Link.
Get Tickets At: http://www.ClickMixers.com/boatcruise.html

(Leader- Joanne)

New Rules: RoundRobin 3 teams of 4 players. Teams rotate every 10 minutes. Please bring a white shirt, a dark shirt(black,navy,dark grey) and a bright colored shirt(red,blue,yellow,orange,pink,green)

We'll have a dark team, white team and the colors team

Arrive on time 6:15pm!!! Late comers will wait on the sidelines to be placed in the game.

We start at 6:30pm.

4v4 small goals

Rules:

Fun Play
No Sliding
Goals after half point only.
kick-ins.. no throw ins.
Corner kicks.
Kick-off at midpoint after each goal.

To promote generosity, honor and respect, PS2G plays clean soccer!! This means No Cursing, Insulting, Complaining, Arguing or Fighting! We welcome you if this is your usual style and you want to change your attitude to fit our culture.

The fee is  $4 via paypal, The proceeds go to our charity network: http://ps2g.org/charities

Bring indoor shoes or sneakers, Dark,colors and white shirt

Please be sure you are definitely showing up when RSVPing.
Refunds are only given when PS2G cancels a game. If the game is canceled, please go to this link <http://ps2g.org/games/refund-request>; for a refund.

There is a minimum of 3v3 with 6 RSVPs needed to have a game. Game will be cancelled if this number is not reached 1 hour before the game time. Check comments for updates from Game Leader.

If you can't afford the meetup fees, please visit our website to learn how to become a game leader. Game Leaders play for free. http://ps2g.org/gameleaders

PS2G enables soccer players to organize fundraising pickup games that support our charity network ultimately promoting the safe play of soccer for disadvantaged children.

Disclaimer By taking part in group activities you hereby are agreeing to the rules and regulation of the meetup. In addition, you acknowledge you are volunteering to play at your own self will and at your own risk. Neither organizer nor assistant organizers are responsible for any injuries or mishaps while partaking in the games. We encourage love of the game and for each other. We encourage friendly competition. Organizers reserve the right to remove players from the game if they refuse to be friendly.

results.description:
Welcome to the Brooklyn Ark’s main weekly event—our Sunday Gathering (6:30-8:30pm at 48 Wall Street—5th Floor). If you are looking for a church, synagogue, or space to wrestle with big questions, this is your place. We invite you to plug into the Brooklyn Ark Community this Sunday, and experience the authentic community and intelligent Bible teaching you've been looking for. 

Community

The Brooklyn Ark is made up of people that are getting to know and care about each other. We are making the Big City smaller - one relationship at a time.

Culture

The Brooklyn Ark deeply supports the creative expression of truth through music, poetry & visual arts.  You will discover that we cultivate an art-friendly atmosphere.

Faith

We curiously read and discuss the Bible (Hebrew & Greek Scriptures), asking questions, seeking out answers, and trying to find practical application for our lives. 

Learn more about the Brooklyn Ark: http://www.brooklynark.com/

results.description:
Directions:

CILK119 is located in the garret of the Rockland County times building, at the corner of First and Main in Nanuet, NY. (Our entrance has been compared to the office door of a private eye–cool!) Fear not, we’re up here and we’ve fixed the place up nice! Our neighbors are Dr. Fessel, a podiatrist; Clarkstown Coins; Murielle’s Beauty Salon; Estrella’s Cafe; Village Sensations, a head shop; Ecualimo; and Maveli Indian grocery. Behind us is Diamond Jim’s, a pool hall. Detailed driving directions below. Find the door marked “119″ (one in front, one in back) and come on up!

From Upstate New York: NYS Thruway 287 toward Tappan Zee Bridge. Take Exit 14 to Spring Valley/Rte 59. At the light, turn left. Proceed east on NY State Route 59 to Main St./Middletown Rd. Turn right at the light. Proceed about 1/4 mile south on Main St./Middletown Rd. We are located in the Rockland County Times building, which will be on your right, at the corner of First St. Parking is available on the street, behind the building, and at the Rand office building, also on the right on the corner of Main/First.

From NYC/Palisades Parkway: Take Exit 8W, Route 59 West toward Nanuet. Proceed west on NY State Route 59 to Main St./Middletown Rd. Turn left at the light. Proceed about 1/4 mile south on Main St./Middletown Rd. We are located in the Rockland County Times building, which will be on your right, at the corner of First St. Parking is available on the street, behind the building, and at the Rand office building, also on the right on the corner of Main/First.

From Westchester/Tappan Zee Bridge: Take NYS Thruway 287/87 toward Albany. Take Exit 14 to Spring Valley/Rte 59. At the light, turn left. Proceed east on NY State Route 59 to Main St./Middletown Rd. Turn right at the light. Proceed about 1/4 mile south on Main St./Middletown Rd. We are located in the Rockland County Times building, which will be on your right, at the corner of First St. Parking is available on the street, behind the building, and at the Rand office building, also on the right on the corner of Main/First.

From New Jersey: Take the Garden State Parkway north to the NYS Thruway toward the Tappan Zee Bridge. Take the first exit, 14 to Spring Valley/Rte 59. At the light, turn left. Proceed east on NY State Route 59 to Main St./Middletown Rd. Turn right at the light. Proceed about 1/4 mile south on Main St./Middletown Rd. We are located in the Rockland County Times building, which will be on your right, at the corner of First St. Parking is available on the street, behind the building, and at the Rand office building, also on the right on the corner of Main/First.

Staten Island Volleyball Club - Fall Sunday Coed 6's League starts on September 13th.  Multiple divisions; Intermediate/Advanced & Rec/Intermediate.  Season is 12 weeks with all teams playing 4 games to 25 with referees each night.  Playoffs are tentatively scheduled for November 29th.  Prizes for all winning teams!  Sign up as a team or as an individual and be placed on a team. Cost is $110 per person for the season.  Please contact Anthony @[masked] with any questions.

Divisions:

Intermediate/Advanced - This division is open to more experienced players only.  You must know how to pass with accuracy, set, hit and block. Also must be able to run multiple offensive sets and know advanced positioning.

Rec/Intermediate - This division is open to wider range of abilities, but no beginners.  You must have some experience playing and know how to run a basic 4-2 offense, pass, set and hit, and know basic positioning.

*There is limited space in each division so sign up ASAP!

Each week dozens of CRC members and friends gather following the 5:30 mass at Holy Trinity to socialize, network and connect.  It is a great way to meet others in the group in a fun and casual way.

This week we will be going to Canteen 82 who has donated to our charity events in the past.  Hang out at the bar and socialize or sit and have a bite to eat with the group, separate checks are no problem. 

Can I come alone?  Yes, Sunday is the best time to come on your own as almost everyone comes on their own.  Dave will be on hand to welcome everyone old and new.

Do I need to be a member of Holy Trinity Parish? No many of our members belong to other parishes.

What if I went to the earlier mass?  Not a problem, come for the gathering and enjoy food and drink

The group will meet on the sidewalk after mass (approx 6:30pm) then walk over together or you can meet us at the restaurant.

Paul is the host for this Sunday.

Ok folks, it's the third Sunday of the month, again- the day you all get to have a great time being being horrible people with a rousing game of Cards Against Humanity. Because so many of you enjoy it, we decided it was best to give you monthly recurring opportunities to be horrible. I'm sure we're doing a great service providing a safe outlet for these urges.

We'll be playing at The Uncommons, a tabletop gaming cafe. If by any chance Cards Against Humanity isn't your thing, they literally have a menu of dozens of games for you to enjoy, along with more typical menus for things like food and drink. For the small fee of $5 plus tax, all of these things will be available to you for the entire evening (The games, not the food and drink).

So come out and enjoy the guilty pleasure of being acceptably horrible with a card game, or play another game and sit in quiet judgment of the rest of us (both options have their appeal). Either way, join us for some fun games and good company this weekend.

results.description:
"Tuning the mind, body, and soul"-Gaynor

The sound and silence meditation group meets every Sunday. The meditation begins with 30 min. of  toning*, 30 minutes of silent meditation, In the last 10 min. there is time for a brief discussion, questions, or sharing.


According to Gaynor (1999, p. [masked]), "Sounds enters the healing equation from several different directions: It may alter cellular functions through energetic effects; it may entrain biological systems to function more homeostatically; it may becalm the mind and therefore the body; or it may have emotional effects, which influence neurotransmitters and neuropeptides, which in turn help regulate the immune system-the healer within. Music is organized sound that has potent emotional effects and stimulates memories, associations, and highly developed  psychological states with clear impact on our healing systems."

 Toning* in your own voice is a very powerful tool for self-healing, relaxation, personal growth, opening creativity, and helping to balance life experiences.Toning is the elongation of a note or tone using breath and voice to assist you to get still enough to meditate.
It is great.....
• If you have a difficult time getting still enough to meditate;
• If you desire higher states of consciousness;
• If your communication energy center seems blocked;
• If you breathe too shallowly;
• If you need immediate grief or stress relief;
• If you're depressed;
• If you need more confidence or zest;
• If you have trouble listening, focusing or being in the moment

We look forward to seeing you at the next scheduled meet-up!Please e-mail me at [masked] if you have any questions or concerns.

Please try to arrive on time and refrain from wearing fragrances.  Cushions and folding chairs are available or you can bring your own. RSVPs open 3 days prior to event at 8pm.

This evening is Competitive Play (Intermediate/Advance). Perfect for those who want to step-up their game. 

Having less experienced players in the more intense Sunday night setting is both unsafe and unfair to the other attendees. But all are welcome to attend Friday nights. (Use your own judgement of skill level before signing up for Sunday) 

Players are expected to be able to handle free pass, pass accurately, and most important "BUMP SET SPIKE" with every effort not to just return the ball on the other side. Regular volleyball rules will be more closely enforced


Please RSVP only if you are 100% sure you can make it.  When you RSVP, you are holding a spot for a meetup that has high demand.  No refunds will be issued if you decide to cancel.  

Only players on the ACTIVE list will be allowed to play (No Exceptions).  If you must cancel, allow your spot to be given to someone on the wait list. 


RULES:

-Carrying will be called

-Doubles will be called if too obvious

- NO REDOS on ANY ceiling obstacles

-No top Net touches (Bottom Net is okay)

-No going under the net on the opposite side of the court. (Safety)

results.description:
New Swing Dance Session With Spencer @ The JCC in Manhattan

334 Amsterdam Avenue, New York, NY @76th street

 with  Spencer Weisbond

Six week, progressive session

  102: Advanced Beginner -  7:30 -8:30pm Advance in Jitterbug and East Coast Swing by learning more involved patterns with harder footwork. Build your dance vocabulary and partnering skills. This class is the prerequisite for Lindy Hop (level 3), which is the grandfather of all swing dances and has 8-count patterns. No partner needed


  103: Lindy Hop﻿ Pre-Intermediate 8:30- 9:30pm
Bring all your moves together into complete sequences. Learn new eight-count patterns to make your dance more intricate and expressive.  

  Teacher: Spencer Weisbond please call me with questions about your level[masked]
Level one is now on Wednesday nights!
  Register and pricing below:

  Level 102:  http://ebiz.jccmanhattan.org/personifyebusiness/Programs/ProgramDetail.aspx?pid=633153420</a>

Level 103: http://ebiz.jccmanhattan.org/personifyebusiness/Programs/ProgramDetail.aspx?pid=634125361<a href="http://ebiz.jccmanhattan.org/personifyebusiness/Programs/ProgramDetail.aspx?pid=631567294">

</a>

Spencer has been dancing swing since 1998. He has studied Lindy hop extensively with 4 time world champion and 8 time American champion, Nathalie Gomes. Spencer had led the outreach program for Hop Swing And & Jump dance studios at local venues around NYC.
Spencer has had his own program in swing at the JCC in Manhattan for over 8 years, and also teaches privately. He has taught for Lincoln Center’s “Midsummer Night Swing” He currently organizes the New York City Swing Dance Meetup Group, which has over 3400 members, making it one of the most active swing dance clubs in the world. Spencer also co-founded the popular NYC dance  event “Swing Remix”. <a href="http://www.SwingRemix.com">www.SwingRemix.com </a>

<a href="http://ebiz.jccmanhattan.org/personifyebusiness/Programs/ProgramDetail.aspx?pid=135408">

results.description:
I want to thank everyone who came out for this, What a great show and an amazing meetup. we had so many people we couldnt accomodate all but its was a great show and i hope everyone met each other. Were gonna continue doing this as long as the club lets us. I met some of the most fun and amazing people, the comics were a full top Comedy Central line up too. For those of you who havent been to this, This is a special Meetup, we finally got a deal with Stand Up New York the hottest club in New York City to let us in free of charge and see comics like Amy Shumer, Godfrey, Kevin Brennan and top names, this is NOT an amateur show like alot of the meetups. I just ask that everyone who Rsvp's really do their best to show up AND MAKE IT ON TIME. as you know I dont charge for this meetup so come out see the hottest comedy show and maybe even make some new friends. this sundays line up includes the below.

Host Leah Bonnema brings you Mike Cannon (MTV), Gregory K (Orange is the new black Reds husband), Jon Fisch (letterman), Brian Scott McFadden (tonight show), and your Headliner Greer Barnes! and pretty much any comic you see on Comedy Central these days drops by and shows up on the lineup who knows who might drop by usually its Amy Shumer or Judah Friedlander.

I will be at the front end of the bar by the iphone charger as usual to meet with everyone and give you tickets for free admission and have everyone sit together so we can all share laughs. Try to be early the show starts at 8 and everyone sits at same table but i do this earlier so all of you can meet your fellow meetup members.

This is a 2 show ticket, so if you show up for the 8 you can stay for the ten also which has a different but also comedy central lineup. Or if you would like to come for the 10 you can just say meetup at the door and they will point you to me.

I just ask that everyone who Rsvp's really do their best to show up AND MAKE IT ON TIME. as you know I dont charge for this meetup so come out see the hottest comedy show and maybe even make some new friends. this sundays line up includes the below.

Host Leah Bonnema brings you Mike Cannon (MTV), Gregory From Russia (Orange is the new black Reds husband), Jon Fisch (letterman), Brian Scott McFadden (tonight show), and your Headliner Greer Barnes! and pretty much any comic you see on Comedy Central these days drops by and shows up on the lineup who knows who might drop by usually its Amy Shumer or Judah Friedlander.

I will be at the front end of the bar by the iphone charger as usual to meet with everyone and give you tickets for free admission and have everyone sit together so we can all share laughs. Try to be early the show starts at 8 and everyone sits at same table but i do this earlier so all of you can meet your fellow meetup members.

This is a 2 show ticket, so if you show up for the 8 you can stay for the ten also which has a different but also comedy central lineup. Or if you would like to come for the 10 you can just say meetup at the door and they will point you to me.

results.description:
We've planned this now as a weekly meetup, so that everyone in the group can get together even if the moderator can't be there.

If Darren can't make it to introduce everyone (he can't this week), could someone please take it upon themselves to 1) stake out the big table a little early, 2) Lead a go-around-the-horn o? introductions at 8pm, and 3) Time the 60 minutes of writing time and let everyone know when it's 9 pm.

As always,

Please RSVP only if you can make it, and update as soon as possible if your plans change. We have had far too many no-shows.

You will see progress in your writing project by spending the minimum of a single hour per week on it. This is your practice/focus time, so I hope to see you there.

Join other writers for an hour of focused writing!

7-8 pm - Show up early, stake out a spot and either socialize or get a jump on writing.
8:00 - Start. Introductions, and we'll share what we're working on
8:05 - Get down to business. An hour of silence and solid writing!
9:05- Brief follow up. People are encouraged to share experiences & ideas, network or take off as they like. Feel free to keep writing if you've got the momentum going! Be aware Argo closes at 10pm.
If you're spending too much time THINKING about writing, come and join us for a session of focused writing. It may just be "pipe-cleaning" for now, but you'll feel better showing up at the page. No one will see what you've written or give you unsolicited advice.

WHERE: Argo Tea Cafe, Columbus Circle Subway Station. 1792 Broadway.

SOME TIPS:

Argo has plenty of outlets - we will be on the back, large table.
Seats are hard to come by, and I can only save so many, so please, come on time! If you come late, we might have already started.
The music and occasionally nonmember conversation can be loud, so bring headphones too.
WiFi is available with purchase.
It's a little chilly, so if you get cold bring a sweater.
And it goes without saying that buying a cup of joe or a snack from Argo for being nice enough to host us will bring you good writing karma.
If you aren't sure you can make it, please don't RSVP! Come on time or even a little early, as it can be difficult to save seats.
results.name: NYC Shut Up & Write Meetup! - Columbus Circle

results.description:
We all grow up. It's a natural process as a human being and there is no way we can stop that. As an adult, we have to deal with many headaches and responsibilities every day-we know that! But it doesn't have to be ALWAYS like that. Let's take a break once in a while and recapture the feeling of what it's like to be a child again. 


I am sure that many of you know (and love) the following poem written by A.A. Milne, the author of Winnie the Pooh:

Water Lilies

Where the water-lilies go
To and fro,
Rocking in the ripples of the water,
Lazy on a leaf lies the Lake King's daugher,
And the faint winds shake her.
Who will come and take her?
I will! I will!
Keep still! Keep still!
Sleeping on a leaf lies the Lake King's daughter. . . .
Then the wind comes skipping
To the lilies on the water;
And the kind winds wake her.
Now who will take her?
With a laugh she is slipping
Through the lilies on the water.
Wait! Wait!
Too late, too late!
Only the water-lilies go
To and fro,
Dipping, dipping,
To the ripples of the water.

What if we can hear this poetry read by a music teacher from U.N. International School and listen to live jazz music composed/played by jazz masters including John Ellis <a>http://www.johnaxsonellis.com </a>based upon this poetry? Wouldn't that be a perfect way to reconnect with our inner child? 

Please see the following links for your reference:

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=N8pl0Eh99LE

http://www.whilewerestillyoung.net


And please also see the following list of all the other reputable musicians participating in this event, there are eight (8) of them!!! It's not quartet or quintet...it's octet!!!!

Patrick Cornelius: saxophones, flute http://www.patrickcornelius.com

Marquis Hill: trumpet http://www.marquishill.com

John Ellis: tenor saxophone, bass clarinet http://www.johnaxsonellis.com

Nick Vayenas: trombone http://www.nickvayenas.com

Nate Radley: guitar http://www.nateradley.com

Glenn Zaleski: piano http://www.glennzaleski.com

Peter Slavov: bass http://www.peterslavov.com

Eric Doob: drums http://www.ericdoob.com


Here is the deal for our group : Patrick Cornelious, the leader of the band will give attendees from our group his signed CD (of these A.A. Milne themed musics) for free. Just RSVP here to receive it. $10 cover, $10 minimum (cash only at the door, minimum applied towards final bill). I am also happy to arrange a brief meet and greet with the musicians only if you wish :)


There is one set from 8:30pm

Hope we can meet up and travel back to the time when simple things could make us just happy :D

Angie.

10,000 PB&Js is a volunteer led organization meets each week in White Plains & the lower east side to make and assemble several hundred meals and then distribute them in small teams throughout Manhattan to the homeless. 

The PB&Js and Hershey Kisses are their starting point: a means to begin a conversation, to listen and lay the foundation of trust necessary to offer more substantial help.

This event is for PB&J DISTRIBUTION:


Volunteers gather on East 11th for orientation, then break up into teams of 3 or 4 volunteers who distribute food, clothing & toiletries on pre-assigned routes. Finish times vary by team: some will be done before 11 pm and other teams might work until midnight. 

THIS IS A RECURRING EVENT!
10,000 PB&Js typically feeds a couple hundred neighbors each Sunday and would be thrilled to extend a up to 6 distribution spots for our group each week!

results.description:
Colorado Jennifer granola girl is back in town and so what a better way to welcome her back for while then to hike Mt Beacon in the morning !

Directions From NY Route 9D, look for Bob's Corner Store in Beacon. Turn east onto Howland Avenue. then immediately turn right into the parking area for Scenic Hudson's Mount Beacon Park.

Public Transportation: Metro-North Hudson Line to Beacon station -- walk uphill to trailhead

Trail info- We will be taking the steps from the Gateway park to the Red trail. The trail is 6 or 7 switchbacks up to the old casino with a very rewarding lookout point where you can see sweeping views of the Hudson River and surrounding area.

Distance: 4 miles round trip


The First 0.8 miles of this hike is hard, and very steep with 1000ft. elevation gain. Mount Beacon is the second highest point in the Hudson Highlands. Depending on the map, it may be called Mount Beacon or Beacon Mountain. The mountain consists of two peaks. The northern peak is 1531ft and has a series of radio antennas on its summit. The higher southern peak is 1610ft and has a lookout tower on its summit. On a clear morning we will see the NYC skyline lights from the summit as well as views of the town of Beacon and the majority of the Highlands (including Storm King, Breakneck Ridge, and little Sugarloaf).


You agree when you sign up for this group or any of the events that you have read and understand the below.


If you join us for a hike (or any other event), please understand that you are responsible for your own preparedness and well-being and will hold no one else liable in case of injury or mishap. You agree not to hold the Organizer, Assistant Organizers, or any other members responsible for any injuries, mishaps, or any other situation that may happen at a planned event. You are responsible to research the event, know the area, and bring the proper gear.

This one workout will keep you amped up all week long. Seriously, give it a try and you will be hooked!


The exercises may change from week to week, but it is always a Tabata-style interval workout: 20 seconds of high intensity work followed by 10 seconds of rest. Then repeat! Exercises include sprints, burpees, squats, situps, box jumps, step ups, pushups, dips, and other “no-frills” exercises.


Warm up beforehand by running, biking, or walking. We start promptly at 6:30 AM and the workout only lasts 31 minutes. Show up a few minutes early to meet people and get yourself pumped up.

results.description:
"It was deep it was soulful, it was techno, it was disco, a kaleidoscope of sounds, it was truly underground. It was an essential mix in the cloud where we could dance and sing out loud. It was New York, Ibiza and Miami all wrapped up into one. There were speakers the size of skyscrapers and the stars they flickered like strobes, and everybody loved everybody else...I must have went to house heaven, because nothing’s that divine."                                                       

—Roland Clark

That’s right, we’re calling on all our DJ's to contribute for our weekly radio shows broadcast www.soundboxonline.com. What better way to keep those decks moving and keeping them from stagnating by pooling the tracks that tickle your fancy and inspire you as a DJ.


A mix is a great way to showcase your talent, the tracks that get you bumping and the tracks that have inspired you on the path of DJ-ing. So think of the bedroom as your house of worship. Honor it, pay reverence to it and give us a damn good mix worthy of the pantheon of the DJ gods on Mt. Olympus. 


Some common ground rules to ensure a quality mix and ensure serious commitment:

•  House, deep-house, tech-house, techno, minimal, EDM or any other genre that fits into the house category.


• High quality mp3/wav 320kbps. 

• Record a 1 hour mix without peaks, in other words; no clipping!


• Transitions need to be well segued, near flawless

• Sample mix required to ensure DJ commitment and whether or not you make the cut for the radio show


• A great profile pic


So once you’ve ticked all these off the list, you’re on your way to getting your DJ mix broadcasted. We’re especially reaching out to our new and beginning DJ's looking to make their mark. Send us a link where we can download your mix. Also send us a picture, so we can add it to the visual in case your mix has been selected for the weekly broadcast. Looking forward to hearing some great mixes.


Ayelmer Veenstra --- LMR

A.D.G. 

~ pls. send the visual and the link to (download) your mix to: [masked]

results.description:
Musikalische Mäuse is a German music and movement program for babies, toddlers, and preschoolers. The song material used in class derives from the German folk tradition, spiced up with a contemporary flair, allowing families to reconnect with their own childhood memories and passing them on to the next generation in a fun-filled way. Old and young will enjoy learning how to use the songs creatively and how to include them in their daily routines. We invite non-German speakers to join in as well, and make sure that everyone can follow easily. 

The classes are age appropriately designed. They are infused with finger plays, dance segments and instrument exploration and provide a rich environment for music development, creativity and cognitive development. 

Learning a language through music is very effective. Rhythm and melody help the brain to memorize with ease. The latest research shows that music has a unique way in activating speech pathways. 

Come and find out what it can do for you and your child.

RSVP HERE

results.description:
YOU MUST REGISTER ON WebEx TO ATTEND.

All attendees will receive the white paper, "Transforming Customer Engagement Using WebRTC APIs and Frameworks," written by business technology analyst Brent Kelly.

WebRTC is an emerging communications standard available on billions of PCs, smartphones, and tablets. It enables real-time voice, video and data sharing in a Web browser without the need for browser plugins or downloads. When WebRTC-enabled applications are coupled with contact centers, customer engagement can be transformed because customers and prospects can communicate with a contact center agent via voice or video from within the context of browsing a web page or from within a dedicated mobile app. This user context can accompany the call to the contact center agent, thus giving agents more information about a user intent, which allows the agent to satisfy the user’s needs faster and better.

Join business communication and technology expert analyst Brent Kelly of KelCor, Inc. and Plantronics Vice President of Innovation and New Ventures, Cary Bran as they discuss how organizations can rapidly develop and deploy WebRTC-enabled applications using WebRTC APIs.

Brent Kelly

Brent Kelly is Principal Analyst at KelCor, Inc. where he focuses on business communications processes and technologies. Dr. Kelly provides strategy and counsel to Chief Information Officers, Chief Technology Officers, investment analysts, VCs, technology policy executives, sell side firms and technology buyers. He has been an independent consultant and analyst 15 years, writing hundreds of articles and presenting at numerous public and private events. Dr. Kelly has served as the CEO of a privately held manufacturing company, and prior to this, he was part of the team at Schlumberger that built the devices Intel used to test Pentium microprocessors. He also led teams developing real-time data acquisition and control systems, and adaptive intelligent design systems in several Schlumberger Oil Field services companies including four years of R&D experience in Europe. He has a Ph.D. in engineering from Texas A&M University and a B.S. in engineering from Brigham Young University. Dr. Kelly is serving in his second term as an elected official in his community.

Cary Bran

Cary Bran serves as Vice President of Innovation and New Ventures at Plantronics. In this role, Cary leads the research and development of next generation software and device concepts and products, including efforts to deliver integrations between wearable devices and web browsers via WebRTC. Cary is also responsible for leading PLT Labs, a multi-disciplinary team within Plantronics that is working to identify and develop advanced wearable technologies that can be leveraged by developers to create new wearable tech-based applications.

Cary’s background includes more than sixteen years of experience developing enterprise collaboration and communications software solutions. Prior to joining Plantronics, Cary was at Cisco Systems for more than a decade, where he held positions in software architecture, business development and technical strategy. As part of his tenure at Cisco he led the internal WebRTC evangelism efforts and contributed to the IETF and W3C WebRTC standards development.

Cary holds a BS (Cum Laude) in Computer Science from Seattle University and an MBA from the Foster School of Business at the University of Washington.
results.name: Transforming Customer Engagement Using WebRTC APIs

results.description:
Join other new mamas at these meetings tailored to moms of newborns up to 12 months old. We'll discuss the ups and downs of life with a newborn/baby -- all aspects of breastfeeding (successes and challenges), the realities of caring for a baby, navigating the new world of parenting, sleeping patterns (or lack thereof) for you and your baby, and much more. But most importantly, the hope is that you will meet other Rivertown/Westchester moms of babies who will become treasured new friends. This is a group for all new mamas, including second-timers and formula-feeding mamas. The group size varies from week to week, but it's typically 6-10 moms. Further information is available here:

http://www.rivertownmamas.com/groups.html

The group operates on a pay-what-you-wish model, and payment is made anonymously (unless paid by credit card). Suggested: $20 per meeting.
results.name: New moms' discussion group

results.description:
Join this special free LIVE online event from across the world.

With meditation and visualisation, this powerful 30 minute broadcast features beautiful sounds and music to uplift, energise and inspire.

Experience the benefit of the enhanced collective energy of meditating with other people, whilst being in the comfort of your own home or office.

Each meditation includes an introduction, followed by a time in which to meditate in whatever way is easy and natural to you.

You are then guided through a visualisation enabling you to focus on living your ideal life.

 

Participating Live:

The broadcast begins promptly at 2.00pm and finishes at 2.30pm.

***Please click to join Meditation 101 Live at the scheduled broadcast time ***

Please note that the meditation and visualisation are pre-recorded to ensure sound quality however participation with other people from across the world is live.

Meditation 101 Live works best with the following internet browsers: Internet Explorer, Chrome, Safari and Opera.

If you need any technical help connecting to Meditation 101 Live please click here.

Testimonials:

"That was absolutely amazing! I don't think I have ever fully let go and quieted my mind like that before. I feel so inspired. By the end of the session I was filled with so much love - love for myself, for others, and love coming from Source. Unconditional, pure love. Thank you." C.L.

"Instead of the 'knowledge gained', I find it appropriate to give a 5 star to 'raising my vibrations' during the meditation.... the energy of the group was Amazing and ZINGING! Thanks... " - S

"Thank you Tracy for a wonderful start to the day. Amazing calmness capturing everyone's energy on the class. Look forward to attending the next on-line class. Thank you." - B.J

"Very enlightening and a positive way for those that can't make it physically to do so remotely.""Thank you, the second section moved me the most. I had a real moment of knowing who I was, am and always be. Also, I have in the past trained in yoga and meditation but not practiced for a number of years - I felt all the beauty of it flowing connecting through my source once again aaaahhh bliss." - A.S.

"Truly inspirational, loved it, thank you ." - Anonymous

"Really loved being able to just switch on and meditate." - L.M.

"So relaxing and cleansing." - T.H.

"Awesome meditation Tracy! One of the most powerful sessions I have ever had. Wow." - G.R.

"I absolutely loved the meditation. The music was one that I truly enjoyed. Thank you so much for this. Many blessings to you." - S.

FOR DETAILS OF ALL UPCOMING 'MEDITATION 101 LIVE' SESSIONS PLEASE CLICK HERE.

Follow Meditation 101 Live on Facebook, Twitter and LinkedIn.

results.description:
45 minutes of diving into the teachings, techniques, and practice of Meditation, for new and experienced Meditators.

All meditations are meant to purify our heart and bring our mind to its natural condition. Our consciousness is inherently pure, eternal, full of knowledge and bliss. But somehow or other it has been covered by and adulterated by so many misconceptions, so many desires, so many longings, so many anxieties about what we want and what we don’t want. 

When you look into a mirror, you see yourself. But what if that mirror has been neglected for hundreds of years? There are layers and layers of debris, dust, dirt and filth. And when you look into that mirror, all you see is the dust and the dirt that is accumulated, and all that you think is “This is me!” But when you clean the mirror, little by little you start seeing the image of yourself. And when the mirror is actually clean, you see who you are. Meditation is for that purpose; prayers are for that purpose; spirituality is for that purpose: to cleanse our heart, to cleanse our life-style so that we can actually directly experience our own essence, which is eternal, full of knowledge and full of love
results.name: Let's meet up and Meditate

results.description:
Chers ami(e)s,

Thank you for making our now WEEKLY event "Jadore le French" a great success : c’était ma première surprise partie :-) Pictures posted below ! Let's meet again at Cellar Bar to speak French (or at least try a bit with Manhattans).

Special Thanks&HugsⓇ to the new members : you guys rock !Congratulations to Gabor and Abderaman, winners of the last raffle.

MegaHugsⓇ to Amelia, Hostess Etincelante, inventor of a new game using French quotes. 

French is not such a difficult language. If Rocky Balboa can speak Russian, if Rambo can speak Dari, then everybody can speak French, just a question of time :-) The new format "Jadore-le-French" is even nicer than our "Pardon-my-French" of last year.

To facilitate connections and meet&greets, we will have a special fun "lottery" :

Each of you will be given one of my polaroids (http://myinstantfilms.com/). Only TWO PAIRS will be identical. The 4 winners will get an invitation for two at Crepes & Delices, a brand new French crêperie located on 72nd and Columbus. THEY DO HAVE REAL GALETTES DE SARRASIN, AVIS AUX AMATEURS :

http://crepesanddelices.com


Come and get rewards by :

1. Dressing super nicely

2. Showing progress in your French skills (whatever you start from)

None of these are an obligation, neither a demand, just an incentive for rewards (perfumes, hats, free bottles of wine etc.).

Who are the organizers ? Yara, Handsome President, and Jean-Philippe, Glorieux Président. Since 3 weeks, Amelia, aka Superamelia, has joined the team as Hostess Étincelante.

IN THREE YEARS, WE HAVE ORGANIZED HUNDREDS OF SOCIAL EVENTS, FRENCH LESSONS/WORKSHOPS, FRENCH CONCERTS (including launching Flo, now superstar!) etc.

Merci beaucoup et à lundi prochain !

Join Foodstand, the hub of good food pioneers, and Slow Money NYC for an evening of drinks and collaborative thinking, as we invite entrepreneurs, creators and innovators in the food space for an opportunity to showcase their product or business to a diverse panel of experts and audience collaborators who’ve all shown up with one mission: To help good food ventures be the best they can be.

Please order Eventbrite tickets through the following link: http://www.thefoodstand.com/spotlight

6:00PM: Office Hours + Doors Open 

7:00PM: Community Announcements + Alumni Keynote + Introductions

7:10PM: Each presenter gets 4 minutes to showcase their product. Experts share thoughts in the next 4. Audience votes on live-text questions from the Entrepreneur.

8:15PM: Drinks and Networking

Entrepreneurs, Creators, Innovators

Have a food or drink business that you're working on? Inspired bySlow Money Principles? Have an existing local shop or online food venture that you want feedback on? Have some questions you want to audience of food-lovers and experts to weigh in on? Get involved: http://www.thefoodstand.com/spotlight 

Panel of Experts

We're looking for established domain experts inspired by Slow Money Investment Criteria who have experience with food businesses, investing, marketing, storytelling, brand voice, refining product, and tasting in the sector, and are excited to provide feedback to food businesses. Get involved: http://bit.ly/1IOpoiq

Please order Eventbrite tickets through the following link: http://www.thefoodstand.com/spotlight

results.description:
Note: the date of this event has shifted to Monday, September 21


Join us for our next tech talk as John Murray, Senior Software Engineer at AppNexus, serves up an introduction to Actor System principals and concepts and gives a look at how we can construct parallel systems using the Akka framework. 

Actor Systems, also known as Actor Models, is a computational model for designing concurrent, distributed systems around the principal of self-contained Actors which operate on sending and receiving messages. While the idea has been around since the mid to late 70's, it is now gaining more traction with frameworks such as Akka and Celluloid as well as languages such as Go, which share many similar principals.

The event will also feature live music, food, drink and interactive technology demos. 

RSVP at http://bit.ly/appnexustechtalks
results.name: Introduction to the Actor Model for Concurrent Computation

results.description:
We will be ascending the Major Welch, taking in the sunset and socializing at Perkins Tower, then descending on the AT. Bring a snack and beverage of choice to  enjoy during the break. We will be descending in the dark. Make sure you bring a working headlamp.

We will meet in the main large parking lot closest to the Inn. We will be leaving at 6:00 sharp in order to make the sunset. If you are running late, you are welcome to catch up with the group. This hike is a short distance however the hike up will get your heart pumping. It is a lot of elevation in a short distance.

Make sure you have a copy of the map, a headlamp, and minimum 2 liter of water.  If you fall behind during the hike, you must be prepared to finish on your own. Faster hikers are not obligated to wait for slower hikers. Typically we meet at the parking lot and begin together. As we ascend, the group breaks off. We reconvene at the peak and begin our descent together.  You must feel comfortable hiking out on your own should you fall behind. We would love to have everyone join but due the nature of an evening event we can not make accommodations for those who are unable to hike independently. This is not mean, it is for your protection as well as the safety of the group. If you are unsure whether or not this is for you, please email me with any questions.

Heavy rain may cancel and would be determined that day if necessary.

Distance: about 4 miles round trip

Gain: about 1200

Hike time: approx 3 hours

This is a dog friendly hike. Park rule: on leash 6' or less. My rule: they must have current rabies and Lepto vaccines for our pups protection as well as our hikers.

HUDSON VALLEY HIKER LEGAL DISCLAIMER  & WAIVER OF LIABILITY

You agree when you sign up for this group or any of the events that you have read and understand the below.

If you join us for a hike (or any other event), please understand that you are responsible for your own preparedness and well-being and will hold no one else liable in case of injury or mishap. You agree not to hold the Organizer, Assistant Organizers, or any other members responsible for any injuries, mishaps, or any other situation that may happen at a planned event. You are responsible to research the event, know the area, and bring the proper gear.

The Hudson Valley Hikers Club does not provide liability insurance for the protection of individuals who may participate in any of the events planned by the Organizer or Assistant Organizers.

This release extends and applies to, and also covers and includes, all unknown, unforeseen, unanticipated and unsuspected injuries, damages, loss and liability.

Your attendance on a hike signifies that you have read and accept the terms of this liability waiver. By signing up for this group or event you understand that you are attending all events AT YOUR OWN RISK. Organizers and Assistant

Organizers of this group are just that, we organize the events and hike together as friends. There are no leaders on these hikes, you are your own leader - This is YOUR hike

results.description:
(IF YOUR RSVP'ING, please tell us your first and last name, or you may not be admitted)


(Location/Date Changed!)


Some great stuff in our return to the Maker stage:

• gCreate shows off their newest and coolest 3D printers. gCreate has been going big, just like their printers, which boast some of largest print volumes available.


• Chenoe Hart demos her Smart Storage Cabinet. Imagine a piece of furniture that ensures that you never lose anything again. I'd say "shut up and take my money", but it seems that I've misplaced my wallet...

• Howard Fink shows off his latest efforts in combining Maker know-how and Lunar Topology.

• And NYNTM finalists, BotFactory, shows off their latest incarnation of Squink, the desktop circuit fabrication system.

We have space for more demos - so contact Jonathan if you'd like to show off your amazing stuff! (send a message here)


Plus, well be having folks from New York's Next Top Makers to tell us about the new program, and how to apply.

All this, plus pizza, refreshments, chat, and the traditional after-meetup Maker Beer.

results.description:
Everyone talks about audience engagement but what do they actually mean?

Join StoryForward NYC as we talk to a panel of leading storytellers about how they build communities for their narratives. Andrea Phillips (A Creator’s Guide to Transmedia Storytelling), John T. Trigonis (Crowdfunding for Filmmakers) and Katrina German (One-Story), will discuss how they grow and maintain their audiences. We’ll talk crowdfunding, interactive experiences and much, much more.

ANDREA PHILLIPS 


Andrea Phillips is an award-winning transmedia writer, game designer and author. She has worked on projects such as iOS fitness games Zombies, Run! and The Walk, The Maester's Path for HBO's Game of Thrones, human rights game America 2049, and the independent commercial ARG Perplex City. Her projects have variously won the Prix Jeunesse Interactivity Prize, a Broadband Digital award, a Canadian Screen Award, a BIMA, the Origins Vanguard Innovation Award, and others. Her book A Creator's Guide to Transmedia Storytelling is used to teach digital storytelling at universities around the world.


Her independent work includes the Kickstarted serial  

The Daring Adventures of Captain Lucy Smokeheart

and

The McKinnon Account

, a short story that unfolds in your email inbox.  Her debut novel

Revision

is published by Fireside Fiction Co. and her short fiction has been published in Escape Pod, Fireside Magazine, and the Jews vs. Aliens anthology.

Follow Andrea on Twitter: @andrhia

JOHN T. TRIGONIS

A behind-the-scenes consulting machine, John T. Trigonis has mentored hundreds of filmmakers and other content creators worldwide to create compelling crowdfunding experiences that not only reach, but often exceed their goals. An indie filmmaker and successful crowdfunder himself, Trigonis has literally written the book on Crowdfunding for Filmmakers, (and is currently rewriting it as a second edition) and after spending a few years as a private consultant, he puts his prowess to its ultimate use as Indiegogo’s head Film Campaign Strategist.


Follow John on Twitter: @Trigonis

KATRINA GERMAN

Katrina German is the CEO and cofounder of OneStory.com, an easy way to create and share video interviews. Katrina is passionate about bridging storytelling and technology and the resulting company OneStory.com has collected video interviews from nineteen different countries. Katrina is an award-winning social entrepreneur and a former social media strategist who regularly runs campaigns that reach millions of people.

Follow Katrina on Twitter: 

@Katrinavision
results.name: The Art of Community Building For Storytellers

meta.description: Searches for recent and upcoming public events hosted by Meetup groups. Its search window  is the past one month through the next three months, and is subject to change. Open Events is optimized to search for current events by location, category, topic, or text, and only lists Meetups that have **3 or more RSVPs**. The number or results returned with each request is not guaranteed to be the same as the page size due to secondary filtering. If you're looking for a particular event or events within a particular group, use the standard [Events](/meetup_api/docs/2/events/) method.
